original: gdon mi za bar bdag gis yon gnas dam pa 'di lta bu la bya ba ma byas pa des na /
analyzed: gdon mi za bar bdag gis yon gnas dam pa 'di lta bu la bya ba ma byas pa des na /
translated: “There is no doubt that because I did not do what I should have done for such a holy object of offering,

original: bdag mi'i lus thob na yang mu lto bar skyes kyis /
analyzed: bdag mi'i lus thob na yang mu lto bar skyes kyis /
translated: even though I obtained a human body, I was born poor.

original: gal te bdag nyid chen po 'di bdag las snum khur bzhes par gyur na bdag gis de dbul lo snyam mo //
analyzed: gal te bdag nyid chen po 'di bdag las snum khur bzhes par gyur na bdag gis de dbul lo snyam mo //
translated: If this great being would accept oil for his lamp from me, I would give it to him.”

original: de nas rang sangs rgyas de'i sems kyis de'i bsam pa shes nas pha rol rjes su bzung ba'i ched du de la lhung bzed bzed do //
analyzed: de nas rang sangs rgyas de'i sems kyis de'i bsam pa shes nas pha rol rjes su bzung ba'i ched du de la lhung bzed bzed do //
translated: Then the mind of that solitary buddha knew his thought. In order to take care of him, he held out his alms bowl to him.

original: des de la gus pas snum khur phul lo //
analyzed: des de la gus pas snum khur phul lo //
translated: He respectfully offered the oil to him.

original: bdag nyid chen po de dag ni lus kyis chos ston gyis ngag gis ma yin pas /
analyzed: bdag nyid chen po de dag ni lus kyis chos ston gyis ngag gis ma yin pas /
translated: Great beings teach the Dharma with their bodies, not with their speech.

original: de steng gi bar snang la 'phags te /
analyzed: de steng gi bar snang la 'phags te /
translated: So he rose up into the air

original: 'bar ba dang gsal ba dang char 'bebs pa dang / glog 'byin pa'i chos 'phrul dag bya bar brtsams so //
analyzed: 'bar ba dang gsal ba dang char 'bebs pa dang / glog 'byin pa'i chos 'phrul dag bya bar brtsams so //
translated: and performed the miracles of fire, light, rain, and lightning.

original: so so'i skye bo rnams ni rdzu 'phrul la myur du sems gtod pa yin pas /
analyzed: so so'i skye bo rnams ni rdzu 'phrul la myur du sems gtod pa yin pas /
translated: Ordinary people quickly focus their minds on miracles.

original: de shing rtsa ba nas bcad pa bzhin du rang sangs rgyas kyi rkang pa la gtugs nas smon lam gdab par brtsams pa /
analyzed: de shing rtsa ba nas bcad pa bzhin du rang sangs rgyas kyi rkang pa la gtugs nas smon lam gdab par brtsams pa /
translated: He fell at the feet of the solitary buddha like a felled tree and made this aspiration:

original: bdag gis yon gnas dam pa 'di lta bu la bya ba byas pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba gang yin pa 'di bdag mi gtso bo rnams kyi rgyal por gyur la /
analyzed: bdag gis yon gnas dam pa 'di lta bu la bya ba byas pa'i dge ba'i rtsa ba gang yin pa 'di bdag mi gtso bo rnams kyi rgyal por gyur la /
translated: “Whatever roots of virtue I have created by serving such a holy object of offering, may I become the king of the most important people.

original: @205b 'di las khyad par du 'phags pa'i ston pa mnyes par byed kyi mi mnyes par byed par ma gyur cig ces btab bo //
analyzed: @205b 'di las khyad par du 'phags pa'i ston pa mnyes par byed kyi mi mnyes par byed par ma gyur cig ces btab bo //
translated: May I please a teacher who is superior to this one, and not displease him.”

original: de nas mu lto ba rnams lhags nas smras pa /
analyzed: de nas mu lto ba rnams lhags nas smras pa /
translated: Then the beggars came and said,

original: bdag cag la yang snum khur stsol cig /
analyzed: bdag cag la yang snum khur stsol cig /
translated: “Give us some oil-cake.”

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He said,

original: ngas de bdag nyid chen po'i drang srong de la phul lo //
analyzed: ngas de bdag nyid chen po'i drang srong de la phul lo //
translated: “I offered it to that great being, the sage.”

original: de rnams kyis smras pa /
analyzed: de rnams kyis smras pa /
translated: They said,

original: phul nas khyod kyis smon lam ji skad btab /
analyzed: phul nas khyod kyis smon lam ji skad btab /
translated: “What aspiration did you make after offering it?”

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He said,

original: mi gtso bo rnams kyi rgyal por gyur cig ces byas so //
analyzed: mi gtso bo rnams kyi rgyal por gyur cig ces byas so //
translated: “‘May I become the king of the most important people.’”🔽They said,

original: de rnams kyis smras pa /
analyzed: de rnams kyis smras pa /
translated: They said,🔽Oh!

original: bdag cag kho na khyod kyi mi gtso bo rnams su gyur cing de rnams kyi rgyal por khyod gyur cig /
analyzed: bdag cag kho na khyod kyi mi gtso bo rnams su gyur cing de rnams kyi rgyal por khyod gyur cig /
translated: “We are your most important people, and you are our king.”

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He said,

original: legs kyis de bzhin du gyur cig /
analyzed: legs kyis de bzhin du gyur cig /
translated: “Excellent! May it be so!”

original: khyed cag gis ci drang srong gi zhabs la gtugs te smon lam mi gdab bam /
analyzed: khyed cag gis ci drang srong gi zhabs la gtugs te smon lam mi gdab bam /
translated: “Why don’t you bow down at the sage’s feet and make a prayer?”

original: de rnams kyis rang sangs rgyas de'i rkang pa la gtugs te smon lam btab pa /🔽bdag cag khyod kyi mi gtso bo rnams su gyur cing de rnams kyi rgyal por khyod gyur cig /
analyzed: de rnams kyis rang sangs rgyas de'i rkang pa la gtugs te smon lam btab pa / bdag cag khyod kyi mi gtso bo rnams su gyur cing de rnams kyi rgyal por khyod gyur cig /
translated: They bowed down at the feet of the solitary buddha and made a prayer:

original: ces byas so //
analyzed: ces byas so //
translated: “We are your most important people, and you are our king.”

original: dge slong dag ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: dge slong dag ji snyam du sems /
translated: “Bhikṣus, what do you think?

original: de'i tshe de'i dus kyi mu lto ba'i dpon po gang yin pa de ni sh'akya'i rgyal po bzang ldan 'di nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i dus kyi mu lto ba'i dpon po gang yin pa de ni sh'akya'i rgyal po bzang ldan 'di nyid yin no //
translated: The one who was the leader of the lepers at that time, on that occasion, was none other than the Śākya king Bhadra.

original: mu lto ba de rnams ni sh'akya lnga brgya po 'di dag yin te /🔽'di dag dang bzang ldan mu lto bar gyur pa na /
analyzed: mu lto ba de rnams ni sh'akya lnga brgya po 'di dag yin te /🔽'di dag dang bzang ldan mu lto bar gyur pa na /
translated: Those lepers were these five hundred Śākyas.🔽When they were lepers, Bhadra was their leader.

original: rang sangs rgyas la smon lam btab pa de'i las kyi rnam par smin pas sh'akya lnga brgya po 'di rnams kyi rgyal por gyur to //
analyzed: rang sangs rgyas la smon lam btab pa de'i las kyi rnam par smin pas sh'akya lnga brgya po 'di rnams kyi rgyal por gyur to //
translated: The maturation of that karma is that he became the king of these five hundred Śākyas.

original: dge slong dag de lta bas na las gcig tu gnag pa rnams kyi rna par smin pa ni gcig tu gnag pa yin la zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: dge slong dag de lta bas na las gcig tu gnag pa rnams kyi rna par smin pa ni gcig tu gnag pa yin la zhes bya ba nas /
translated: “Therefore, monks, the maturation of entirely negative actions is entirely negative…”

original: dge slong dag khyed kyis de lta bu la bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gong ma bzhin du'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag khyed kyis de lta bu la bslab par bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gong ma bzhin du'o //
translated: “Therefore, monks, you should train thinking, ‘We will act and not be acted upon.’ ”

original: sangs @206a *// rgyas bcom ldan 'das sgra gcan gyi drang srong kun rdzi ka'i gnas na bzhugs so //
analyzed: sangs @206a *// rgyas bcom ldan 'das sgra gcan gyi drang srong kun rdzi ka'i gnas na bzhugs so //
translated: The Blessed Buddha was staying at the sage Rāvaṇa’s place of practice in Laṅkā.

original: de'i tshe lhung bzed rab tu mang po dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis lhung bzed bla gab med par bzhag go /
analyzed: de'i tshe lhung bzed rab tu mang po dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis lhung bzed bla gab med par bzhag go /
translated: At that time there were many alms bowls, and the Blessed One placed his alms bowl outside.

original: de nas spre'u zhig shing s'a la las babs nas lhung bzed rnams gang na yod pa der song ba dang / dge slong rnams kyis lhung bzed rnams bcag tu 'ong zhes de bzlog go /
analyzed: de nas spre'u zhig shing s'a la las babs nas lhung bzed rnams gang na yod pa der song ba dang / dge slong rnams kyis lhung bzed rnams bcag tu 'ong zhes de bzlog go /
translated: Then a monkey came down from a sāl tree to where the alms bowls were, and the monks stopped him, saying, “Don’t break the alms bowls!”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das kyis dge slong rnams la bka' stsal pa /
translated: Then the Blessed One said to the monks,

original: dge slong dag spre'u 'dis lhung bzed rnams bcag par mi 'gyur gyis 'di ma bzlog cig /
analyzed: dge slong dag spre'u 'dis lhung bzed rnams bcag par mi 'gyur gyis 'di ma bzlog cig /
translated: “Monks, this monkey will not break the alms bowls. Do not drive him away.”

original: de nas spre'u de bcom ldan 'das kyi lhung bzed gang na ba der song ste phyin nas /
analyzed: de nas spre'u de bcom ldan 'das kyi lhung bzed gang na ba der song ste phyin nas /
translated: Then the monkey went to where the Blessed One’s alms bowl was.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi lhung bzed khyer te shing s'a la de la 'dzeg nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi lhung bzed khyer te shing s'a la de la 'dzeg nas /
translated: He took the Blessed One’s alms bowl and climbed the śāla tree.

original: sbrang bu'i sbrang rtsi dvangs mas bkang ste /
analyzed: sbrang bu'i sbrang rtsi dvangs mas bkang ste /
translated: He filled it with fresh honey from the bees,

original: rim gyis dal bu dal bus shing s'a la las babs nas bcom ldan 'das la phul ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis de srog chags dang bcas pa yin pas ma bzhes so //
analyzed: rim gyis dal bu dal bus shing s'a la las babs nas bcom ldan 'das la phul ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis de srog chags dang bcas pa yin pas ma bzhes so //
translated: and slowly, slowly he descended from the śāla tree and offered it to the Blessed One. The Blessed One did not accept it because it contained living creatures.

original: de nas spre'u de mtha' gcig tu song nas srog chags bsal te /
analyzed: de nas spre'u de mtha' gcig tu song nas srog chags bsal te /
translated: Then the monkey went to one side and removed the living creatures.

original: bcom ldan 'das la phul ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis de brtags pa ma yin no zhes ma bzhes so //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la phul ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis de brtags pa ma yin no zhes ma bzhes so //
translated: He offered it to the Blessed One, but the Blessed One did not accept it, saying, “It is not examined.”

original: de nas spre'u de mtha' gcig tu song ste chu grang mos btab nas bcom ldan 'das la phul ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis de brtags pa byas so zhes bzhes so //
analyzed: de nas spre'u de mtha' gcig tu song ste chu grang mos btab nas bcom ldan 'das la phul ba dang / bcom ldan 'das kyis de brtags pa byas so zhes bzhes so //
translated: Then the monkey went to one side, cooled it with cold water, and offered it to the Blessed One, and the Blessed One accepted it.

original: de nas spre'u de bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag gi sbrang rtsi'i lhung bzed bzhes so snyam du rig nas dga' ba dang / mgu ba dang / dga' ba rgya chen po dang / yid @206b bde ba skyes nas thal mo khong stong du sbyar ba byas te /🔽phyi nur du gar byed cing phyag 'tshal ba las de bcom ldan 'das la dad pa skyes nas /
analyzed: de nas spre'u de bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag gi sbrang rtsi'i lhung bzed bzhes so snyam du rig nas dga' ba dang / mgu ba dang / dga' ba rgya chen po dang / yid @206b bde ba skyes nas thal mo khong stong du sbyar ba byas te / phyi nur du gar byed cing phyag 'tshal ba las de bcom ldan 'das la dad pa skyes nas /
translated: Then the monkey, thinking, “The Blessed One has accepted my bowl of honey,” was filled with joy, delight, pleasure, and happiness, and with palms placed together,🔽he danced and bowed to the Blessed One.🔽Because he was filled with faith in the Blessed One,

original: bcom ldan 'das la rtog cing rgyab tu ma bltas pas khron par lhung nas shi ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das la rtog cing rgyab tu ma bltas pas khron par lhung nas shi ste /
translated: he fell into the pit and died.

original: sgra gcan nyid kyi bram ze las drug la brtson pa zhig gi khyim du skyes so //
analyzed: sgra gcan nyid kyi bram ze las drug la brtson pa zhig gi khyim du skyes so //
translated: He was reborn in the home of a brahmin who was devoted to the six duties and was Rāhu himself.

original: gang gi nyi ma kho na la nying mtshams sbyor ba blangs pa de kho na'i nyi ma la sbrang rtsi'i char bab bo //
analyzed: gang gi nyi ma kho na la nying mtshams sbyor ba blangs pa de kho na'i nyi ma la sbrang rtsi'i char bab bo //
translated: On the very day that he was conceived, a rain of honey fell.

original: de'i phas ltas mkhan rnams bkug nas smras pa dang / de rnams kyis smras pa /
analyzed: de'i phas ltas mkhan rnams bkug nas smras pa dang / de rnams kyis smras pa /
translated: His father summoned the diviners and said to them, “Why did this happen?”

original: sems can 'di'i mthu yin no //
analyzed: sems can 'di'i mthu yin no //
translated: They said, “It is the power of this being.”

original: ji tsam na bram ze mo de zla ba brgyad dam dgu 'das nas khye'u zhig btsas so //
analyzed: ji tsam na bram ze mo de zla ba brgyad dam dgu 'das nas khye'u zhig btsas so //
translated: When the brahmin lady had completed eight or nine months, she gave birth to a boy.

original: gang gi nyi ma kho na la btsas pa de kho na'i nyi ma la sbrang rtsi'i char bab bo //
analyzed: gang gi nyi ma kho na la btsas pa de kho na'i nyi ma la sbrang rtsi'i char bab bo //
translated: On the very day that he was born, a rain of honey fell.

original: de'i nye du rnams 'tshogs shing 'dus nas nyi ma bdun gsum nyi shu rtsa gcig tu de'i btsas pa'i btsas ston rgya cher byas nas /
analyzed: de'i nye du rnams 'tshogs shing 'dus nas nyi ma bdun gsum nyi shu rtsa gcig tu de'i btsas pa'i btsas ston rgya cher byas nas /
translated: His relatives gathered and for twenty-one days celebrated his birth with a great feast.

original: khye'u yi ming cir gdags zhes ming 'dogs par byed do //🔽nye du rnams kyis smras pa /
analyzed: khye'u yi ming cir gdags zhes ming 'dogs par byed do // nye du rnams kyis smras pa /
translated: They asked, “What name should we give this child?”

original: khye'u 'di gang gi nyi ma kho na la ma'i rum du zhugs pa de kho na'i nyi ma la sbrang rtsi'i char bab la /
analyzed: khye'u 'di gang gi nyi ma kho na la ma'i rum du zhugs pa de kho na'i nyi ma la sbrang rtsi'i char bab la /
translated: His relatives said, “On the very day that this child entered his mother’s womb, a rain of honey fell.

original: gang gi nyi ma kho na la btsas pa de kho na'i nyi ma la yang sbrang rtsi'i char bab la gnas 'jog dang yang rus gcig pas de lta bas na /
analyzed: gang gi nyi ma kho na la btsas pa de kho na'i nyi ma la yang sbrang rtsi'i char bab la gnas 'jog dang yang rus gcig pas de lta bas na /
translated: On the very day he was born, a rain of honey fell, and since he was of the same clan as Pūrṇa,

original: khye'u yi ming gnas 'jog gi bu sbrang rtsi can zhes bya bar gdags so zhes de'i ming gnas 'jog gi bu sbrang rtsi can zhes bya bar btags so //
analyzed: khye'u yi ming gnas 'jog gi bu sbrang rtsi can zhes bya bar gdags so zhes de'i ming gnas 'jog gi bu sbrang rtsi can zhes bya bar btags so //
translated: he was named Pūrṇa Maitrāyaṇī­putra.

original: de bsrings bskyed nas chen por gyur to //
analyzed: de bsrings bskyed nas chen por gyur to //
translated: He was raised and grew up.

original: gang gi tshe chen por gyur pa de'i tshe legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung ste /🔽de rab tu byung nas kyang nyi ma re re zhing sbrang rtsi lhung @207a *//
analyzed: gang gi tshe chen por gyur pa de'i tshe legs par gsungs pa'i chos 'dul ba la rab tu byung ste / de rab tu byung nas kyang nyi ma re re zhing sbrang rtsi lhung @207a *//
translated: When he became a man, he went forth in the well-proclaimed Dharma and Vinaya.

original: bzed gsum gsum grub par gyur te /
analyzed: bzed gsum gsum grub par gyur te /
translated: After going forth, every day he would obtain three bowlfuls of honey.

original: des de rnams las gcig ni bcom ldan 'das la 'bul lo //
analyzed: des de rnams las gcig ni bcom ldan 'das la 'bul lo //
translated: He would offer one to the Blessed One,

original: gnyis pa ni dge 'dun la'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni dge 'dun la'o //
translated: one to the saṅgha,

original: gsum pa ni grogs bshes dang lhan cig longs spyod par byed do //
analyzed: gsum pa ni grogs bshes dang lhan cig longs spyod par byed do //
translated: and enjoy the third together with his friends.

original: dge slong rnams the tshom skyes nas /
analyzed: dge slong rnams the tshom skyes nas /
translated: The monks were doubtful

original: the tshom thams cad gcod pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa /
analyzed: the tshom thams cad gcod pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa /
translated: He asked the Blessed Buddha, who cuts through all doubts,

original: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das tshe dang ldan pa gnas 'jog gi bu sbrang rtsi can gyis las ci zhig bgyis na /
analyzed: btsun pa bcom ldan 'das tshe dang ldan pa gnas 'jog gi bu sbrang rtsi can gyis las ci zhig bgyis na /
translated: “Lord, what karma did the venerable Madhu, the son of Vāṣpa, create

original: las de'i rnam par smin pas gdugs re re zhing sbrang rtsi lhung bzed gsum gsum grub par gyur lags /
analyzed: las de'i rnam par smin pas gdugs re re zhing sbrang rtsi lhung bzed gsum gsum grub par gyur lags /
translated: that ripened into his obtaining three alms bowls of honey every day?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: dge slong dag gnas 'jog gi bu sbrang rtsi can nyid kyis las tshogs rnyed pa rkyen yongs su bsgyur ba /
analyzed: dge slong dag gnas 'jog gi bu sbrang rtsi can nyid kyis las tshogs rnyed pa rkyen yongs su bsgyur ba /
translated: “Monks, the very same Madhu, the son of Vāṣpa, accumulated the karma.

original: 'od pa bzhin du nye bar gnas pa zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: 'od pa bzhin du nye bar gnas pa zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The conditions have changed,

original: lus can dag la 'bras bur 'gyur zhes bya ba'i bar gong ma bzhin du'o //
analyzed: lus can dag la 'bras bur 'gyur zhes bya ba'i bar gong ma bzhin du'o //
translated: and the karma is ripening, just as before.

original: dge slong dag khyed kyis de bzhin gshegs pa la sbrang rtsi'i lhung bzed 'bul ba'i spre'u gang yin pa de mthong ngam /
analyzed: dge slong dag khyed kyis de bzhin gshegs pa la sbrang rtsi'i lhung bzed 'bul ba'i spre'u gang yin pa de mthong ngam /
translated: Monks, did you see the monkey who offered the Blessed One the alms bowl of honey?”

original: btsun pa mthong lags so //
analyzed: btsun pa mthong lags so //
translated: “Yes, Lord, we saw him.”

original: de'i tshe de'i dus kyi spre'u gang yin pa de ni gnas 'jog gi bu sbrang rtsi can 'di nyid yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i dus kyi spre'u gang yin pa de ni gnas 'jog gi bu sbrang rtsi can 'di nyid yin te /
translated: The one who was that monkey then is none other than this very Mṛṣa, the son of Vāsiṣṭha.

original: de na 'dis de bzhin gshegs pa la sbrang rtsi'i lhung bzed phul ba de'i las kyi rnam par smin pas bram ze las drug la brtson pa'i khyim du skyes shing /
analyzed: de na 'dis de bzhin gshegs pa la sbrang rtsi'i lhung bzed phul ba de'i las kyi rnam par smin pas bram ze las drug la brtson pa'i khyim du skyes shing /
translated: Because of the evolution of his having offered a bowl of honey to the Tathāgata, he was born into a family of brahmins who were diligent in the six duties,

original: nying mtshams sbyor ba blangs pa dang btsas pa na yang sbrang rtsi'i char bab bo //
analyzed: nying mtshams sbyor ba blangs pa dang btsas pa na yang sbrang rtsi'i char bab bo //
translated: and when he was conceived and born, a rain of honey fell.

original: 'di ltar da ltar yang nyi ma re re zhing sbrang rtsi lhung bzed gsum gsum 'grub par 'gyur ro //🔽@207b dge slong dag de lta bas na las gcig tu gnag pa rnams kyi rnam par smin pa ni gcig tu gnag pa yin la zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: 'di ltar da ltar yang nyi ma re re zhing sbrang rtsi lhung bzed gsum gsum 'grub par 'gyur ro // @207b dge slong dag de lta bas na las gcig tu gnag pa rnams kyi rnam par smin pa ni gcig tu gnag pa yin la zhes bya ba nas /
translated: And so now, every day, three bowls of honey are produced for him.

original: las gcig tu dkar ba la brtsal bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gong ma bzhin du'o //
analyzed: las gcig tu dkar ba la brtsal bar bya'o zhes bya ba'i bar gong ma bzhin du'o //
translated: “Therefore, monks, the evolution of entirely negative actions is entirely negative…” and so on, as above, up to “…you should strive for entirely positive actions.”

original: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
analyzed: de ci'i phyir zhe na /
translated: Why is that?

original: gal te dge slong gnas 'jog gi bu sbrang rtsi can gyis shar gyi rgya mtsho chen po la sbrang rtsir mos shing /
analyzed: gal te dge slong gnas 'jog gi bu sbrang rtsi can gyis shar gyi rgya mtsho chen po la sbrang rtsir mos shing /
translated: If the monk Upasena, who is full of honey,🔽were to think of the great eastern ocean as honey,

original: lho dang / nub dang / byang gi rgya mtsho chen po dag sbrang rtsir mos na /
analyzed: lho dang / nub dang / byang gi rgya mtsho chen po dag sbrang rtsir mos na /
translated: and were to think of the great southern, western, and northern oceans as honey,

original: de dag kyang sbrang rtsir 'gyur te /
analyzed: de dag kyang sbrang rtsir 'gyur te /
translated: they would become honey.

original: dge slong dag de lta na yon gnas de bzhin gshegs pa ni dpag tu med pa yin no //

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /

original: de bzhin du byos shig /
analyzed: de bzhin du byos shig /

analyzed: de nas bdud rtsi zas kyis dge sbyong dang / bram ze dang / bkren pa dang / phongs pa dang / 'gro bar chas pa'i slong ba po rnams kyis phyir sbyin pa dag gtong du bcug /

original: bsod nams dag byed du bcug /
analyzed: bsod nams dag byed du bcug /

analyzed: rang gi skye bo dang gnyen gyi tshogs rnams la yang gzod pa gsol du bcug nas /

original: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan te /
analyzed: rgyan thams cad kyis brgyan te /
translated: Then, adorned with all ornaments,

analyzed: glang po che la zhon nas skye bo du mas yongs su bskor te /

analyzed: n+ya gro dha'i kun dga' ra ba logs su phyogs te /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi spyan sngar btang ngo //

original: de yang srang gi dbus nas 'gro ba na glang po ches autpa la'i chun po zhig zos so //
analyzed: de yang srang gi dbus nas 'gro ba na glang po ches autpa la'i chun po zhig zos so //

original: mtshan mkhan rnams kyis mthong nas de rnams kyis smras pa /
analyzed: mtshan mkhan rnams kyis mthong nas de rnams kyis smras pa /

analyzed: gzhon nu 'di ni thos pa 'dzin pa rnams kyi mchog tu 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de ji tsam bzhon pa'i sa'i bar du bzhon pas song nas bzhon pa las babs te /

original: rkang pa kho nas n+ya gro dha'i kun dga' ra bar zhugs nas /
analyzed: rkang pa kho nas n+ya gro dha'i kun dga' ra bar zhugs nas /
translated: On foot he entered the Nyagrodha Park.

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der song ste phyin pa dang / bcom ldan 'das kyi zhabs gnyis la mgo bos phyag byas te /
translated: He went to the Blessed One, touched his head to the Blessed One’s feet,

original: phyogs gcig tu 'dug go /
analyzed: phyogs gcig tu 'dug go /
translated: and sat to one side.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'od srung gzhon nu rab tu phyung shig ces 'od srung stobs bcu ldan la gtad nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'od srung gzhon nu rab tu phyung shig ces 'od srung stobs bcu ldan la gtad nas /

analyzed: des de rab tu phyung bsnyen par rdzogs par byas so //

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das ser skya'i gzhir ji tsam bzhed kyi @213a *//🔽bar du bzhugs nas rgyal po'i khab gang na ba der rgyu zhing gshegs te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das ser skya'i gzhir ji tsam bzhed kyi @213a *// bar du bzhugs nas rgyal po'i khab gang na ba der rgyu zhing gshegs te /
translated: Then the Blessed One stayed in Kapilavastu as long as he wished,🔽and then set out wandering toward Rājagṛha.

analyzed: rim gyis rgyu zhing gshegs pa dang / rgyal po'i khab tu byon nas /
translated: Wandering in stages, he arrived at Rājagṛha,

analyzed: rgyal po'i khab 'od ma'i tshal bya ka lan ka gnas pa na bzhugs so //
translated: where he stayed in the Bamboo Grove, in the squirrels’ feeding ground.

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo'i spyi bor phol mig byung nas /

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis 'tsho byed la bka' stsal pa /

analyzed: dge slong kun dga' bo la dpyad byos shig /

analyzed: btsun pa bka' bzhin 'tshal zhes 'tsho byed gzhon nus bskyed kyis bcom ldan 'das las mnyan to //
translated: “Respected One, I will do as you say,” replied Jīvaka Kumārabhūta to the Blessed One.

analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi gung la gdan bshams pa nyid la bzhugs nas chos 'chad do //
translated: Then the Blessed One sat on the seat prepared for him in front of the community of monks and taught the Dharma.

original: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo yang chos mnyan pa'i phyir de nyid na 'dug go /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo yang chos mnyan pa'i phyir de nyid na 'dug go /

original: 'tsho byed gzhon nus bskyed kyis bsams pa /
analyzed: 'tsho byed gzhon nus bskyed kyis bsams pa /
translated: Jīvaka Kumārabhūta thought,

analyzed: 'di chos la dad pa bde bar gyur pas mi tshor gyis /
translated: “He is not aware of this because he is comfortable with his faith in the Dharma.

analyzed: dpyad bya ba'i dus la bab bo snyam nas des de'i phol mig smin par 'gyur ba dag bskus nas de nyid du bral te de nyid du sos bar byas so //

analyzed: de na chos bshad pa rdzogs nas 'tsho byed kyis gsol pa /
translated: After the teaching was finished, Jīvaka said,

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das bdag gis 'phags pa kun dga' bo 'di nyid na mchis bzhin du phol mig smin par bgyis te brtol nas sos par bgyis lags so //
translated: “Blessed One, while this noble Ānanda was here, I ripened his boil, burst it, and cured him.”

original: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos smras pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos smras pa /
translated: The venerable Ānanda said,

analyzed: gal te bdag gi lus til 'bru tsam du btubs par gyur kyang bdag gis mi tshor lags so //
translated: “Even if my body had been cut into pieces the size of sesame seeds, I would not have felt it.”

analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi chos las byung ba'i dad pas bsam pa bsdus pa la 'tsho byed mchog tu ya mtshan skyes so //
translated: Jīvaka was amazed at the faith that had arisen in him from the Blessed One’s teaching.

analyzed: dge slong rnams the tshom skyes @213b nas the tshom thams cad gcod pas sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa /

analyzed: btsun pa tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos las ci zhig bgyis na /
translated: “Venerable, what action did the venerable Ānanda take

original: des na spyi bor phol mig byung bar gyur lags /
analyzed: des na spyi bor phol mig byung bar gyur lags /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Monks, the actions were performed and accumulated by Ānanda himself in the past,

analyzed: dge slong dag dge slong kun dga' bo 'di nyid kyis las byas shing bsags pa dag ni zhes bya ba nas /
translated: “Monks, the monk Ānanda himself performed and accumulated actions…

analyzed: lus can dag la 'bras bur 'gyur zhes bya ba'i bar gong ma bzhin du'o //

analyzed: dge slong dag sngon byung ba yul mtha' 'khob cig na rgyal po ki ra ta zhes bya ba gnas so //
translated: “Monks, once there was a king named Kirī in a certain border region.

original: sangs rgyas rnams 'byung ba med pa na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams 'byung ba med pa na /
translated: When the Buddhas do not appear,

original: 'jig rten du rang sangs rgyas dman pa dang ngan pa la snying brtse ba can pas mtha'i gnas mal la dga' ba /
analyzed: 'jig rten du rang sangs rgyas dman pa dang ngan pa la snying brtse ba can pas mtha'i gnas mal la dga' ba /
translated: in the world there appear Pratyekabuddhas, who are compassionate toward the lowly and the destitute.🔽They delight in remote abodes,

original: 'jig rten gyi yon gnas gcig pu pa dag 'byung bar 'gyur bas /
analyzed: 'jig rten gyi yon gnas gcig pu pa dag 'byung bar 'gyur bas /
translated: and are the sole field of merit for the world.

analyzed: de nas rang sangs rgyas zhig de dang der rgyu ba na /
translated: Then a certain Pratyekabuddha, wandering here and there,

original: ki ra ta'i grong khyer du phyin nas /
analyzed: ki ra ta'i grong khyer du phyin nas /
translated: arrived at the city of Kirī.

analyzed: de der bsod snyoms kyis phyir ki ra ta'i rgyal po'i khyim du zhugs pa dang / de de la mi bzod pa skyes te /

original: sems gdug pas 'jim ril gyi ngan kong gis rgyab tu bsnun pa las /
analyzed: sems gdug pas 'jim ril gyi ngan kong gis rgyab tu bsnun pa las /

analyzed: bdag nyid chen po de dregs pa dang / nga rgyal bcom pa yin pas /
translated: The great man had already destroyed pride and arrogance.

original: de snod du ma gyur par shes nas song ngo //
analyzed: de snod du ma gyur par shes nas song ngo //

original: dge slong dag ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: dge slong dag ji snyam du sems /

analyzed: ki ra ta'i rgyal po gang yin pa de ni dge slong kun dga' bo de nyid yin te /
translated: The one who was the king of Kirāta then is none other than the bhikṣu Ānanda.

analyzed: gang 'dir rang sangs rgyas la mi bzod pa bskyed de sems gdug pas 'jim ril gyi ngan kong gis rgyab tu bsnun pa de'i las kyi rnam par smin pas /
translated: The karma of his developing an attitude of malice toward the solitary buddha and striking him on the back with a clod of mud

analyzed: tshe rabs lnga brgyar gang dang gang du skye ba de dang der spyi bor phol mig byung bar gyur to //

analyzed: 'di ltar da ltar 'di'i srid pa tha ma la @214a *//

original: yang spyi bor phol mig byung ngo //
analyzed: yang spyi bor phol mig byung ngo //
translated: he was born with a boil on his head.

original: gang gi tshe tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo bcom ldan 'das dang thabs cig 'gro ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo bcom ldan 'das dang thabs cig 'gro ba de'i tshe /
translated: “Whenever the venerable Ānanda went with the Bhagavān,

analyzed: de bcom ldan 'das la lhag par dad pa dang gus pa dang khrel yod pa dang ngo tsha shes pa dang 'dzem pa nyid kyis nye bar gnas so //
translated: He was always present with the Blessed One, with faith, respect, modesty, and conscientiousness.

analyzed: gang gi tshe sprul pa yin na ni dad pa dang gus pa dang ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa dang 'dzem pa de 'dra ba dag gis mi gnas so // ji tsam na khyim bdag cig gis sangs rgyas la sogs pa dge slong gi dge 'dun rang gi khyim du gdugs tshod la spyan drangs pa dang / bcom ldan 'das snga dro na bza' sham thabs mnabs /
translated: But when he was an emanation, he was not present with such faith, respect, modesty, conscientiousness, and scruples.🔽One day a householder invited the Buddha and the rest of the saṅgha of monks to his house for a meal.🔽In the morning the Blessed One put on his lower robe and upper robe,

original: lhung bzed dang chos gos bsnams te /
analyzed: lhung bzed dang chos gos bsnams te /
translated: took his alms bowl,

original: dge slong gi tshogs kyis yongs su bskor cing /
analyzed: dge slong gi tshogs kyis yongs su bskor cing /
translated: and surrounded by the assembly of monks

original: dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi mdun gyis bltas nas /🔽khyim bdag de'i khyim du gshegs te /
analyzed: dge slong gi dge 'dun gyi mdun gyis bltas nas / khyim bdag de'i khyim du gshegs te /
translated: and with the saṅgha of monks in front of him,🔽he went to the house of that householder.

original: gdugs tshod gsol nas slar gshegs so //
analyzed: gdugs tshod gsol nas slar gshegs so //
translated: After the meal, he left.

original: dge slong rnams kyi tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la dris pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyi tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la dris pa /
translated: The monks asked the venerable Ānanda,

analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo ci de ring khyod bcom ldan 'das dang thabs cig song ngam /
translated: “Venerable Ānanda, did you go with the Blessed One today, or with a magical creation?”

original: 'on te sprul pa dang / des smras pa /
analyzed: 'on te sprul pa dang / des smras pa /
translated: He replied,

original: bcom ldan 'das dang thabs cig song gi /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dang thabs cig song gi /
translated: “I went with the Blessed One,

analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa dang ni ma yin no //
translated: not with a magical creation of the Buddha.”🔽“What makes you say that?”

original: ci mngon / gang gi tshe kho bo bcom ldan 'das dang thabs cig 'gro ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: ci mngon / gang gi tshe kho bo bcom ldan 'das dang thabs cig 'gro ba de'i tshe /
translated: “When I go with the Blessed One,

analyzed: bdag bcom ldan 'das la lhag par dad pa dang gus pa dang / ngo tsha shes pa dang / khrel yod pa dang / 'dzem pas nye bar gnas pa yin no //
translated: I am filled with faith, respect, shame, integrity, and modesty toward the Blessed One.

original: gang gi tshe sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa yin pa de'i tshe de ltar @214b mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gang gi tshe sangs rgyas kyi sprul pa yin pa de'i tshe de ltar @214b mi 'gyur ro //
translated: When I go with a magical creation of the Buddha, that is not the case.”

original: dge slong dag phan tshun smras pa /
analyzed: dge slong dag phan tshun smras pa /
translated: The monks said to each other,

original: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo ni mtshan ma la mkhas so //
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo ni mtshan ma la mkhas so //
translated: “The venerable Ānanda is skilled in the marks.”

original: phyogs dang phyogs mtshams rnams su /
analyzed: phyogs dang phyogs mtshams rnams su /
translated: In all directions and in between,

original: dge slong kun dga' bo mtshan ma la mkhas so zhes bya ba'i sgra bsgrags so //
analyzed: dge slong kun dga' bo mtshan ma la mkhas so zhes bya ba'i sgra bsgrags so //
translated: and the sound of the proclamation “The monk Ānanda is skilled in the marks” was heard.

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab tu ji tsam bzhed kyi bar du bzhugs nas /🔽mnyan yod gang na ba der rgyu zhing gshegs te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das rgyal po'i khab tu ji tsam bzhed kyi bar du bzhugs nas / mnyan yod gang na ba der rgyu zhing gshegs te /
translated: Then the Blessed One stayed in Rājagṛha for as long as he liked,🔽and then he went wandering toward Śrāvastī.

original: rim gyis rgyu zhing gshegs pa dang mnyan yod du byon nas /
analyzed: rim gyis rgyu zhing gshegs pa dang mnyan yod du byon nas /
translated: Wandering in stages, he arrived in Śrāvastī,

analyzed: mnyan yod na rgyal bu rgyal byed kyi tshal mgon med zas sbyin gyi kun dga' ra ba na bzhugs so //
translated: and he stayed in the Jetavana, in the park of Anāthapiṇḍada.

original: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo snga dro sham thabs bgos //
analyzed: de nas tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo snga dro sham thabs bgos //
translated: Then the venerable Ānanda, in the morning, put on his under robe,

analyzed: chos gos dang lhung bzed thogs nas mnyan yod du bsod snyoms kyi phyir zhugs pa bram ze zhig gis mthong nas bsams pa /
translated: took his robes and bowl, and entered Śrāvastī for alms. A brahmin saw him and thought,

original: dge sbyong go'u ta ma'i nyan thos dge slong kun dga' bo mtshan ma la mkhas so zhes thos pa gang yin pa de ni 'di yin gyis /
analyzed: dge sbyong go'u ta ma'i nyan thos dge slong kun dga' bo mtshan ma la mkhas so zhes thos pa gang yin pa de ni 'di yin gyis /
translated: “This is the one I heard is called the monk Ānanda, a disciple of the ascetic Gautama, who is skilled in the marks.

original: re zhig shing sha pa zhes pa 'di la 'dam ma du yod pa dri'o snyam nas des de la dris pa /
analyzed: re zhig shing sha pa zhes pa 'di la 'dam ma du yod pa dri'o snyam nas des de la dris pa /
translated: The elder thought, For the time being, I will ask him how many leaves the śāpala tree has.

original: 'phags pa shing sha pa 'di la 'dab ma ji snyed mchis /🔽des smras pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa shing sha pa 'di la 'dab ma ji snyed mchis / des smras pa /
translated: He asked, Noble one, how many leaves does this śāpala tree have?

original: brgya dang stong dang khri phrag 'di snyed yod do zhes smras nas song ngo //
analyzed: brgya dang stong dang khri phrag 'di snyed yod do zhes smras nas song ngo //
translated: He replied, It has this many hundreds, this many thousands, this many tens of thousands of leaves. Having said that, he left.

original: bram ze des de la lo ma dag cig btogs nas bgrangs te bor ro //
analyzed: bram ze des de la lo ma dag cig btogs nas bgrangs te bor ro //
translated: The brahmin plucked some leaves from it, counted them, and threw them away.

original: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos bsod snyoms spyad de slar log pa dang / bram ze des yang smras pa /
analyzed: tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos bsod snyoms spyad de slar log pa dang / bram ze des yang smras pa /
translated: The venerable Ānanda went for alms, returned, and the brahmin said again,

original: 'phags pa da ltar shing sha pa 'di la 'dab ma ji snyed mchis mkhyen tam /🔽des smras pa /
analyzed: 'phags pa da ltar shing sha pa 'di la 'dab ma ji snyed mchis mkhyen tam / des smras pa /
translated: Noble one, do you know how many leaves this śāpala tree has now?

original: sngar ni brgya dang stong dang khri phrag 'di snyed yod pa las de las 'di snyed cig btogs so //🔽bram ze de 'phags @215a *//
analyzed: sngar ni brgya dang stong dang khri phrag 'di snyed yod pa las de las 'di snyed cig btogs so // bram ze de 'phags @215a *//
translated: He said, Before, it had this many hundreds, this many thousands, this many tens of thousands of leaves, but this many have been plucked off.🔽The brahmin thought, The noble one is so skilled in calculation!

original: pa ni rtsis la yang de ltar mkhas pa lta zhes mchog tu ngo mtshar skyes so //
analyzed: pa ni rtsis la yang de ltar mkhas pa lta zhes mchog tu ngo mtshar skyes so //
translated: and was extremely amazed.

original: dge slong rnams the tshom skyes nas the tshom thams cad gcod pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams the tshom skyes nas the tshom thams cad gcod pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa /
translated: The monks were doubtful and asked the Buddha, the Blessed One, the one who removes all doubts,🔽

original: btsun pa tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos las ci zhig bgyis na /
analyzed: btsun pa tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos las ci zhig bgyis na /
translated: The monks, feeling doubtful, inquired of the Buddha, the Blessed One, the one who severs all doubts, “Reverend, what action did the venerable Ānanda take

original: des na mtshan ma la mkhas par gyur lags /🔽bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: des na mtshan ma la mkhas par gyur lags / bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: that it ripened into his skill in the marks?”🔽The Blessed One said, “Monks, the actions were performed and accumulated by the monk Ānanda himself.

original: dge slong dag dge slong kun dga' bo 'di nyid kyis las byas shing bsags pa dag ni zhes bya ba nas lus can dag la 'bras bur 'gyur zhes bya ba'i bar gong ma bzhin du'o //
analyzed: dge slong dag dge slong kun dga' bo 'di nyid kyis las byas shing bsags pa dag ni zhes bya ba nas lus can dag la 'bras bur 'gyur zhes bya ba'i bar gong ma bzhin du'o //
translated: As for what was done and accumulated, monks, the results will ripen upon the one who did them.

original: dge slong dag sngon byung ba w'a ra n'a si na bram ze zhig yod pa des rigs mnyam pa las chung ma blangs te /🔽de de dang lhan cig rtse bar byed /🔽dga' bar byed /
analyzed: dge slong dag sngon byung ba w'a ra n'a si na bram ze zhig yod pa des rigs mnyam pa las chung ma blangs te / de de dang lhan cig rtse bar byed / dga' bar byed /
translated: “Monks, once there was a certain brahmin in Vārāṇasī. He took a wife of equal caste🔽and he enjoyed himself with her with great passion.

original: dga' mgur spyod par byed do //🔽de rtse bar byed /
analyzed: dga' mgur spyod par byed do // de rtse bar byed /
translated: He took pleasure with her and made love to her.🔽He enjoyed himself with her with great passion.

original: dga' bar byed /
analyzed: dga' bar byed /
translated: He took pleasure with her and made love to her.

original: dga' mgur spyod par byed pa las khye'u zhig btsas te /
analyzed: dga' mgur spyod par byed pa las khye'u zhig btsas te /
translated: From that lovemaking, a boy was born.

original: zhag bdun gsum nyi shu rtsa gcig tu de btsas pa'i btsas ston rgya cher byas te /
analyzed: zhag bdun gsum nyi shu rtsa gcig tu de btsas pa'i btsas ston rgya cher byas te /
translated: For twenty-one days, three times seven, they celebrated the birth of the child on a grand scale.

original: rigs dang mthun pa'i ming btags nas de bsos bskyed de chen por gyur to //
analyzed: rigs dang mthun pa'i ming btags nas de bsos bskyed de chen por gyur to //
translated: They gave him a name in accordance with his family, and he was raised and grew up.

original: de yul gzhan du song ste mtshan ma'i bstan chos drug khri bslabs so //
analyzed: de yul gzhan du song ste mtshan ma'i bstan chos drug khri bslabs so //
translated: He went to another country and studied the sixty-four arts of divination.

original: de bzhin du tshe rabs lnga brgya'i bar du 'khor ba na 'khor ba'i tshe mtshan ma'i bstan chos drug khri bslabs shing gzhan la yang bstan pa'i rgyu de dang rkyen des gang dang gang du skye ba de dang der mtshan mkhan rnams kyi mchog tu byung ngo //
analyzed: de bzhin du tshe rabs lnga brgya'i bar du 'khor ba na 'khor ba'i tshe mtshan ma'i bstan chos drug khri bslabs shing gzhan la yang bstan pa'i rgyu de dang rkyen des gang dang gang du skye ba de dang der mtshan mkhan rnams kyi mchog tu byung ngo //
translated: In the same way, for five hundred lifetimes, while he was wandering in saṃsāra, he studied the sixty-four arts of divination and taught them to others. By that cause and condition, wherever he was born, he became the best of diviners.

original: 'di ltar da ltar gyi srid pa tha ma la yang mtshan mkhan rnams kyi mchog tu byung ngo //
analyzed: 'di ltar da ltar gyi srid pa tha ma la yang mtshan mkhan rnams kyi mchog tu byung ngo //
translated: In this his last lifetime, he became the best of diviners.

original: ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal la nyi ma @215b re re zhing dro ka'i dus su gzhong bar 'bras s'a lu'i chan dang / bu ram shing gi sdong bu zhig dang sreg pa gnyis lhung la /
analyzed: ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal la nyi ma @215b re re zhing dro ka'i dus su gzhong bar 'bras s'a lu'i chan dang / bu ram shing gi sdong bu zhig dang sreg pa gnyis lhung la /
translated: Every day at mealtime, two roasted quails and a sugarcane stalk fell into King Prasenajit of Kosala’s serving bowl.

original: de gnyis las gcig ni gzhong pa'i steng du 'bab /
analyzed: de gnyis las gcig ni gzhong pa'i steng du 'bab /
translated: One of the two fell into the bowl,

original: cig shos ni sa la'o //
analyzed: cig shos ni sa la'o //
translated: and the other fell on the ground.

original: des tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la rig par byas te /
analyzed: des tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la rig par byas te /
translated: He told this to the venerable Ānanda,

original: des kyang dge slong rnams la'o //
analyzed: des kyang dge slong rnams la'o //
translated: and he told it to the monks.

original: dge slong rnams the tshom skyes nas the tshom thams cad gcod pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams the tshom skyes nas the tshom thams cad gcod pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa /
translated: The monks, having doubts, asked the Blessed One, the Buddha, the one who stops all doubts,

original: btsun pa ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis las ci zhig bgyis na /
analyzed: btsun pa ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis las ci zhig bgyis na /
translated: “Reverend, what karma did King Prasenajit of Kosala create

original: des na 'tshal ma'i dus su gzhong par 'bras s'a lu'i chan dang / bu ram shing gi sdong bu zhig dang sreg pa gnyis lhung la /
analyzed: des na 'tshal ma'i dus su gzhong par 'bras s'a lu'i chan dang / bu ram shing gi sdong bu zhig dang sreg pa gnyis lhung la /
translated: that at mealtime two roasted quails and a sugarcane stalk fell into his serving bowl,

original: de gnyis las cig ni gzhong pa'i steng du 'bab /
analyzed: de gnyis las cig ni gzhong pa'i steng du 'bab /
translated: and one of the two fell into the bowl,🔽and the other fell on the ground?”

original: cig shos ni sa la lhung bar gyur lags /
analyzed: cig shos ni sa la lhung bar gyur lags /
translated: The other fell to the ground.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: dge slong dag ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal 'di nyid kyis sngon gyi tshe rabs gzhan dag tu las byas shing bsags te /
analyzed: dge slong dag ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal 'di nyid kyis sngon gyi tshe rabs gzhan dag tu las byas shing bsags te /
translated: “Monks, King Prasenajit of Kosala himself performed and accumulated actions in the past

original: des na 'di'i zas kyi dus su gzhong par 'bras s'a la'i chan dang bu ram shing gi sdong bu sreg pa gnyis lhung la /🔽de gnyis las gcig ni gzhong pa'i steng du 'bab /
analyzed: des na 'di'i zas kyi dus su gzhong par 'bras s'a la'i chan dang bu ram shing gi sdong bu sreg pa gnyis lhung la / de gnyis las gcig ni gzhong pa'i steng du 'bab /
translated: that ripened such that at mealtime, two things fell into his bowl: cooked rice and a sugarcane stalk.🔽One of them fell on top of the bowl,

original: cig shos ni sa la lhung bar gyur pa ni /
analyzed: cig shos ni sa la lhung bar gyur pa ni /
translated: while the other fell to the ground.

original: dge slong dag sngon byung ba grong khyer w'a ra n'a si na khyim bdag phyug cing nor mang ba longs spyod che ba zhig gnas te /
analyzed: dge slong dag sngon byung ba grong khyer w'a ra n'a si na khyim bdag phyug cing nor mang ba longs spyod che ba zhig gnas te /
translated: “Monks, once in the city of Vārāṇasī there lived a householder who was rich, had great wealth, and was very powerful.

original: de'i mngag gzhug pa rnams kyis zhing pa'i grong nas 'bras s'a lu sar pa zhig dang sreg pa gnyis dang bu ram shing zhig khyer te 'ongs so //
analyzed: de'i mngag gzhug pa rnams kyis zhing pa'i grong nas 'bras s'a lu sar pa zhig dang sreg pa gnyis dang bu ram shing zhig khyer te 'ongs so //
translated: His servants brought back from a village of farmers some new rice, two roasted chickens, and a sugarcane stalk.

original: sangs rgyas rnams 'byung ba med pa na /
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams 'byung ba med pa na /
translated: When no buddhas arise,

original: 'jig rten du rang sangs rgyas dman pa dang / ngan pa la snying brtse ba can bas mtha'i gnas mal la @216a *//
analyzed: 'jig rten du rang sangs rgyas dman pa dang / ngan pa la snying brtse ba can bas mtha'i gnas mal la @216a *//
translated: In the world, the inferior and bad self-awakened ones are those who have compassion.🔽

original: dga' ba / 'jig rten gyi yon gnas gcig pu pa dag 'byung bar 'gyur bas /🔽de nas rang sangs rgyas zhig w'a ra n'a sir 'ongs nas de snga dro sham thabs bgos /
analyzed: dga' ba / 'jig rten gyi yon gnas gcig pu pa dag 'byung bar 'gyur bas / de nas rang sangs rgyas zhig w'a ra n'a sir 'ongs nas de snga dro sham thabs bgos /
translated: “In the world, there will appear solitary buddhas who are kind to the lowly and the wicked, who delight in the solitude of the forest, and who are the sole objects of the world’s generosity.”

original: chos gos dang lhung bzed thogs te bsod snyoms la khyim bdag de'i khyim du zhugs pa na /
analyzed: chos gos dang lhung bzed thogs te bsod snyoms la khyim bdag de'i khyim du zhugs pa na /
translated: Then a solitary buddha came to Vārāṇasī. He put on his lower and upper robes, took up his alms bowl, and entered the householder’s home for alms.

original: des de lus mdzes pa dang sems dang par mthong nas des der de la thog mar lo tog sar pa 'on cig ces smras nas /🔽'bras s'a lu'i chan dang bu ram shing gi sdong bu zhig dang / sreg pa gnyis phul ba las de las gcig ni lhung bzed du lhung ngo //
analyzed: des de lus mdzes pa dang sems dang par mthong nas des der de la thog mar lo tog sar pa 'on cig ces smras nas / 'bras s'a lu'i chan dang bu ram shing gi sdong bu zhig dang / sreg pa gnyis phul ba las de las gcig ni lhung bzed du lhung ngo //
translated: The householder saw that the solitary buddha’s body was beautiful and his mind peaceful. He said to him, “Please take some new grain.”

original: cig shos ni sa la'o //
analyzed: cig shos ni sa la'o //
translated: He offered him cooked rice, a sugarcane stalk, and two roasted fish. One of the fish fell into the solitary buddha’s alms bowl, and the other fell on the ground.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: dge slong dag ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: dge slong dag ji snyam du sems /
translated: “Monks, what do you think?

original: de'i tshe de'i dus kyi khyim bdag gang yin pa de ni rgyal po gsal rgyal 'di nyid yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i dus kyi khyim bdag gang yin pa de ni rgyal po gsal rgyal 'di nyid yin te /
translated: The one who was that householder then is now King Prasenajit.

original: 'dis rang sangs rgyas la 'bras s'a lu'i chan dang / bu ram shing gi sdong bu dang / sreg pa gnyis phul ba de'i las kyi rnam par smin pas lo mang po dang / lo brgya phrag mang po dang / lo stong phrag mang po dang /
analyzed: 'dis rang sangs rgyas la 'bras s'a lu'i chan dang / bu ram shing gi sdong bu dang / sreg pa gnyis phul ba de'i las kyi rnam par smin pas lo mang po dang / lo brgya phrag mang po dang / lo stong phrag mang po dang /
translated: Because he offered cooked red rice, a sugarcane stalk, and two roasted grains to the solitary buddha, the karma ripened such that for many years, many hundreds of years, many thousands of years,

original: lo brgya stong phrag mang por mi'i bde ba nyams su myong ngo //
analyzed: lo brgya stong phrag mang por mi'i bde ba nyams su myong ngo //
translated: and many hundreds of thousands of years he experienced human happiness.

original: da ltar yang 'di'i zas kyi dus su gzhong par 'bras s'a lu'i chan dang / bu ram shing gi sdong bu dang sreg pa gnyis te /
analyzed: da ltar yang 'di'i zas kyi dus su gzhong par 'bras s'a lu'i chan dang / bu ram shing gi sdong bu dang sreg pa gnyis te /
translated: Now, at mealtimes, in his bowl there is cooked red rice, a sugarcane stalk, and two roasted grains.

original: de las gcig ni gzhong pa'i steng du lhung la cig shos ni sa la'o //
analyzed: de las gcig ni gzhong pa'i steng du lhung la cig shos ni sa la'o //
translated: One of them falls into the bowl, and the other on the ground.

original: ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis /
analyzed: ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis /
translated: King Prasenajit of Kosala

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag gi las kyi rgyu ba gcig lung bstan pas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bdag gi las kyi rgyu ba gcig lung bstan pas /
translated: said to the Blessed One, “The Blessed One has explained one of my karmic bonds.

original: sngon gyi mtha'i las kyi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni yod do snyam du rig nas /
analyzed: sngon gyi mtha'i las kyi rnam par smin pa'i 'bras bu ni yod do snyam du rig nas /
translated: “The results of the ripening of past karma exist.”

original: nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa la mngon par dad cing de de ltar @216b las kyi rnam par smin pa la yid ches pa'i blo gros kyis gnas so //
analyzed: nyan thos kyi dge 'dun dang bcas pa la mngon par dad cing de de ltar @216b las kyi rnam par smin pa la yid ches pa'i blo gros kyis gnas so //
translated: With this understanding, he had great faith in the community of hearers.

original: ltas mkhan rnams kyis 'phags pa kun dga' bo ni cod pan gyis bcings par 'gyur ro zhes lung bstan pas ji tsam nam nangs pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo'i dpral bar phol mig byung ngo zhes ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis thos nas /
analyzed: ltas mkhan rnams kyis 'phags pa kun dga' bo ni cod pan gyis bcings par 'gyur ro zhes lung bstan pas ji tsam nam nangs pa dang / tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo'i dpral bar phol mig byung ngo zhes ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis thos nas /
translated: The king heard that the brahmins had predicted that the noble Ānanda would be bound with a diadem, and that when it was morning a boil had appeared on the forehead of the venerable Ānanda.

original: de 'di snyam sems te /
analyzed: de 'di snyam sems te /
translated: He thought,

original: yon gnas rnams la bya ba byas na /
analyzed: yon gnas rnams la bya ba byas na /
translated: “If I do service to those who are worthy of service,

original: bsod nams kyi 'bras bu'i khyad par med par mi 'gyur pas /
analyzed: bsod nams kyi 'bras bu'i khyad par med par mi 'gyur pas /
translated: I will not fail to receive the special results of my merit.

original: ma la bdag gis 'di la rang nyid kyis bkur sti bya'o snyam nas /
analyzed: ma la bdag gis 'di la rang nyid kyis bkur sti bya'o snyam nas /
translated: Therefore I will myself do service to him.”

original: des sman pa thams cad bkug ste /
analyzed: des sman pa thams cad bkug ste /
translated: He summoned all the physicians

original: 'phags pa kun dga' bo'i dpyad gyis shig /
analyzed: 'phags pa kun dga' bo'i dpyad gyis shig /
translated: Noble one, investigate this!🔽When he investigated it, he saw that it was clear that he should do it, and he began to do it.

original: de'i dpyad gsal ba na bya bar brtsams pa dang / ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis /
analyzed: de'i dpyad gsal ba na bya bar brtsams pa dang / ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis /
translated: King Prasenajit of Kosala

original: che dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la rang nyid kyis rtsibs brgya yod pa'i gdugs gzung zhing phral ba'i rtsa 'bebs pa na cod pan gyis bcings so //
analyzed: che dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la rang nyid kyis rtsibs brgya yod pa'i gdugs gzung zhing phral ba'i rtsa 'bebs pa na cod pan gyis bcings so //
translated: held up a parasol with a hundred spokes himself and tied up his hair with his own white turban.🔽The monks,

original: dge slong rnams the tshom skyes nas the tshom thams cad gcod pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams the tshom skyes nas the tshom thams cad gcod pa sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa /
translated: having doubts, asked the Blessed One, the Buddha, the one who removes all doubts,

original: btsun pa tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos las ci zhig bgyis na /
analyzed: btsun pa tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bos las ci zhig bgyis na /
translated: Venerable, what action did the venerable Ānanda do

original: las de'i rnam par smin pas ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la rang nyid kyis rtsibs brgya mchis pa'i gdugs gzung zhing rang nyid kyi cod pan dkar pos bcings te /
analyzed: las de'i rnam par smin pas ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis tshe dang ldan pa kun dga' bo la rang nyid kyis rtsibs brgya mchis pa'i gdugs gzung zhing rang nyid kyi cod pan dkar pos bcings te /
translated: that the result of that action was that King Prasenajit of Kosala held up a parasol with a hundred spokes himself, tied up his own white turban,

original: bsnyen bkur bgyis lags /
analyzed: bsnyen bkur bgyis lags /
translated: and served him?

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa; dge slong dag dge slong kun dga' bo 'di nyid kyis sngon gyi tshe rabs gzhan dag tu las byas shing bsags pa dag ni /🔽zhes bya ba nas /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa; dge slong dag dge slong kun dga' bo 'di nyid kyis sngon gyi tshe rabs gzhan dag tu las byas shing bsags pa dag ni / zhes bya ba nas /
translated: The Blessed One said, “Monks, this monk Nandaka himself, in other lifetimes, performed and accumulated actions

original: lus can dag la 'bras bur 'gyur zhes bya ba'i bar gong ma bzhin @217a *//
analyzed: lus can dag la 'bras bur 'gyur zhes bya ba'i bar gong ma bzhin @217a *//
translated: that were to ripen in his experience.🔽As the Blessed One said, ‘Monks, actions that have been performed and accumulated do not mature in the element of earth, the element of water, the element of fire, or the element of wind.

original: du'o // dge slong dag sngon byung ba w'a ra n'a sir sman pa zhig gnas pa'i drung du rang sangs rgyas nad pa zhig song ba dang / des de la yo byad thams cad kyis bstabs te rang nyid kyis sman dpyad dang bkur sti byas so //
analyzed: du'o // dge slong dag sngon byung ba w'a ra n'a sir sman pa zhig gnas pa'i drung du rang sangs rgyas nad pa zhig song ba dang / des de la yo byad thams cad kyis bstabs te rang nyid kyis sman dpyad dang bkur sti byas so //
translated: Monks, once there was a doctor in Vārāṇasī. A sick solitary buddha came to him, and he provided him with all the necessary provisions, treating him with medicine and respect.

original: dge slong dag ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: dge slong dag ji snyam du sems /
translated: Monks, what do you think?

original: de'i tshe de'i dus kyi sman pa gang yin pa de ni dge slong kun dga' bo 'di nyid yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i dus kyi sman pa gang yin pa de ni dge slong kun dga' bo 'di nyid yin te /
translated: The one who was that doctor then is none other than the monk Nandaka.

original: de na 'dis rang sangs rgyas la bya ba byas nas smon lam btab pa de'i las kyi rnam par smin pas lo brgya phrag du ma dang / lo stong phrag du mar rgyal po dang / blon po dang / bram ze dang khyim bdag rnams kyis 'di la bkur sti byas so //
analyzed: de na 'dis rang sangs rgyas la bya ba byas nas smon lam btab pa de'i las kyi rnam par smin pas lo brgya phrag du ma dang / lo stong phrag du mar rgyal po dang / blon po dang / bram ze dang khyim bdag rnams kyis 'di la bkur sti byas so //
translated: There, after serving a pratyekabuddha, he made a prayer. The karma of that action ripened such that for many hundreds of years and many thousands of years, kings, ministers, brahmins, and householders served him.

original: ji ltar da ltar yang 'di la ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis rtsibs brgya yod pa'i gdugs spyi bor bzung zhing rang nyid kyis bsnyen bkur byas so //
analyzed: ji ltar da ltar yang 'di la ko sa la'i rgyal po gsal rgyal gyis rtsibs brgya yod pa'i gdugs spyi bor bzung zhing rang nyid kyis bsnyen bkur byas so //
translated: And just as now, King Prasenajit of Kosala held a parasol with a hundred spokes over his head and served him himself.”

original: de nas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na ji tsam bzhed kyi bar du bzhugs nas shing s'a la can gang na ba der rgyu zhing gshegs te /
analyzed: de nas bcom ldan 'das mnyan yod na ji tsam bzhed kyi bar du bzhugs nas shing s'a la can gang na ba der rgyu zhing gshegs te /
translated: Then the Blessed One stayed in Śrāvastī for as long as he liked, and then set out wandering toward Sālaka.

original: rim gyis rgyu zhing gshegs pa dang / s'a la can du byon nas s'a la can gyi bram ze'i grong khyer na bzhugs so //
analyzed: rim gyis rgyu zhing gshegs pa dang / s'a la can du byon nas s'a la can gyi bram ze'i grong khyer na bzhugs so //
translated: Wandering in stages, he arrived at Sālaka and stayed in the brahmin village of Sālaka.

analyzed: khyod @250b kyis pha las cung zad ci thob /

analyzed: des smras pa /

analyzed: dge slong dag ji snyam du sems /

translated: The Bhagavān had the remainder of the ghee in his alms bowl distributed to the monks, and Jīvaka said to the monks, “The Bhagavān has had the remainder of the ghee in his alms bowl distributed,” and he bowed down.

analyzed: mar srang sum cu rtsa gnyis so //

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /

analyzed: 'jigs pa rnams kyi dbugs 'byin par mdzad pa'i phyag mngon du brkyang ste /

analyzed: bya rgod kyi phung po'i ri'i phug nas lhas byin gyi spyi bor bzhag ste bden pa gsungs pa /

analyzed: ji ltar nga bu gcig pa sgra gcan zin bzang po la dgongs pa de bzhin lhas byin la yang lhag chad med pa yin zhe na /

analyzed: bden pa des nad zhi bar gyur cig ces bden pa'i tshig gsungs ma thag kho nar lhas byin gyi nad zhi bar gyur cing /
translated: As soon as he spoke these words of truth, Devadatta’s illness was cured.

original: de dbugs chad pa las slar dbugs byung nas /
analyzed: de dbugs chad pa las slar dbugs byung nas /

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi phyag la brtags te /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi phyag la brtags te /
translated: He looked at the Buddha’s hand and🔽recognized it.

original: des shes nas des bsams pa /
analyzed: des shes nas des bsams pa /
translated: He thought,

analyzed: dge sbyong go'u ta ma'i lag pa yin no snyam nas /

original: de bskal pa mi nyung bar ngan g-yo'i kun tu spyod pa /
analyzed: de bskal pa mi nyung bar ngan g-yo'i kun tu spyod pa /
translated: For many eons he had been a trickster.

translated: Because he was a conceited person who had achieved his position through force, he thought, “The great being, the Buddha, has cured my pain,” and he said,

original: don grub khyod sman dpyad khong du chud pa ni legs na /
analyzed: don grub khyod sman dpyad khong du chud pa ni legs na /
translated: “Siddārtha, it is good that you have mastered medicine.

original: 'dis 'tsho bar nus sam /
analyzed: 'dis 'tsho bar nus sam /
translated: Can you cure me with this?”

original: kun tu bcom ldan 'das ni bden pa gsung gis /
analyzed: kun tu bcom ldan 'das ni bden pa gsung gis /
translated: “The Blessed One always speaks the truth.

original: lhas byin tshor ba drag pos nyen pas srog dang 'bral ba na sos par mdzad do zhes sgra @252a *//
analyzed: lhas byin tshor ba drag pos nyen pas srog dang 'bral ba na sos par mdzad do zhes sgra @252a *//
translated: Devadatta, who was suffering from severe pain, was revived from the point of death.”

original: grags pa de lhas byin gyi phyogs shin tu zhen pa rnams kyis kyang thos nas bcom ldan 'das la kye ma'o 'di ni byams pa yang dag pa dang ldan /
analyzed: grags pa de lhas byin gyi phyogs shin tu zhen pa rnams kyis kyang thos nas bcom ldan 'das la kye ma'o 'di ni byams pa yang dag pa dang ldan /
translated: Even the followers of Devadatta, who were very attached to him, heard of this and were amazed, saying, “Oh! He is truly loving.

original: kye ma 'di ni sems can rnams la thugs rje legs par bsgoms pa yin no zhes ngo mtshar du 'dzin par gyur to //
analyzed: kye ma 'di ni sems can rnams la thugs rje legs par bsgoms pa yin no zhes ngo mtshar du 'dzin par gyur to //
translated: Oh! He has truly cultivated compassion for sentient beings.”

original: dge slong rnams kyis lhas byin la smras pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis lhas byin la smras pa /
translated: The monks said to Devadatta,

original: lhas byin khyod ni bcom ldan 'das kyis sos par mdzad kyi gzhan du srog dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: lhas byin khyod ni bcom ldan 'das kyis sos par mdzad kyi gzhan du srog dang bral bar 'gyur ro //
translated: “Devadatta, the Bhagavān has cured you. Otherwise you would have lost your life.”

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He said,

original: de ni dbang du byed pa'i sgyu ma shes te des 'jig rten dbang du byed do //
analyzed: de ni dbang du byed pa'i sgyu ma shes te des 'jig rten dbang du byed do //
translated: “He knows the magic of subjugation. He has subjugated the world.”

original: dge slong rnams kyis smras pa /
analyzed: dge slong rnams kyis smras pa /
translated: The monks said,

original: lhas byin khas blangs de thong la rang gi sems gtan la phob cig /
analyzed: lhas byin khas blangs de thong la rang gi sems gtan la phob cig /
translated: “Devadatta, give up that claim and examine your own mind.

original: khyod ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gsos so //
analyzed: khyod ni bcom ldan 'das kyis gsos so //
translated: The Bhagavān has cured you.”🔽He said,

original: des smras pa mar zhu nas nang zhi bar zad mod /
analyzed: des smras pa mar zhu nas nang zhi bar zad mod /
translated: “My bile has been reduced and my phlegm has been pacified.

original: des kho bo la ci zhig byas /
analyzed: des kho bo la ci zhig byas /
translated: What has he done for me?”

original: 'di ni byas pa mi gzo ba dang byas pa mi tshor ba yin no zhes bya ba nas de rnams chas te /🔽bcom ldan 'das gang na ba der dong nas lhags pa dang / the tshom skyes nas the tshom thams cad gcod pa /
