translated: “This is ingratitude and not appreciating what has been done.”🔽They left and went to where the Blessed One was staying.

original: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa /
analyzed: sangs rgyas bcom ldan 'das la zhus pa /
translated: When they arrived, they asked the Blessed One, the Buddha, the one who severs all doubts,

original: btsun pa lhas byin byas pa mi gzo ba dang byas pa mi tshor ba la gzigs /
analyzed: btsun pa lhas byin byas pa mi gzo ba dang byas pa mi tshor ba la gzigs /
translated: “Lord, how is it that Devadatta is ungrateful and does not appreciate what has been done?”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /🔽dge slong dag da ltar gyi 'di 'ba' zhig tu ma zad de /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa / dge slong dag da ltar gyi 'di 'ba' zhig tu ma zad de /
translated: The Blessed One said,🔽“Monks, this is not the only time he has been ungrateful and not appreciated what has been done.

original: ji ltar 'das pa'i dus na yang 'di byas pa mi gzo ba dang byas pa mi tshor ba de nyon cig /
analyzed: ji ltar 'das pa'i dus na yang 'di byas pa mi gzo ba dang byas pa mi tshor ba de nyon cig /
translated: Listen to what happened in the past.🔽The summary:

original: sdom la / ko'u shi dbang phyug chen po'i sde //
analyzed: sdom la / ko'u shi dbang phyug chen po'i sde //
translated: Kośika, Maheśvara,

original: aa mra dang ni shing rta mo //
analyzed: aa mra dang ni shing rta mo //
translated: Mango, and Rathakāra,🔽Two bears, a king who died,

original: dom gnyis shi ba'i rgyal po dang // nyams par byas dang dzu dzu ka /
analyzed: dom gnyis shi ba'i rgyal po dang // nyams par byas dang dzu dzu ka /
translated: and Jujjuka, and the one who was ruined.

original: dge slong @252b dag sngon byung ba grong rdal med pa'i dgon pa'i gnas skyed mos tshal me tog dang 'bras bu rnam pa sna tshogs dang chu phun sum tshogs pa zhig yod de /
analyzed: dge slong @252b dag sngon byung ba grong rdal med pa'i dgon pa'i gnas skyed mos tshal me tog dang 'bras bu rnam pa sna tshogs dang chu phun sum tshogs pa zhig yod de /
translated: “Monks, in the past there was a forest grove in an isolated place that was endowed with various flowers and fruits and with water.

original: de na ko'u shi ka dang rus gcig pa'i drang srong 'bras bu lhung ba la longs spyod pa zas su rtsa ba dang chu dang 'bras bu za ba /
analyzed: de na ko'u shi ka dang rus gcig pa'i drang srong 'bras bu lhung ba la longs spyod pa zas su rtsa ba dang chu dang 'bras bu za ba /
translated: There lived a sage of the Kauśika clan who subsisted on fallen fruits, ate roots, water, and fruits,

original: pags pa dang shing shun gyon pa zhig gnas te /
analyzed: pags pa dang shing shun gyon pa zhig gnas te /
translated: and wore hides and bark.

original: de'i bsti gnas kyi nye 'khor du ri dvags dang bya rnams 'dris pas ci bder 'khod do //
analyzed: de'i bsti gnas kyi nye 'khor du ri dvags dang bya rnams 'dris pas ci bder 'khod do //
translated: The animals and birds in the vicinity of his hermitage were so tame that they would sit wherever they pleased.

original: de dang ha cang yang thag mi ring bar bal glang mo zhig phru gu byung ste /
analyzed: de dang ha cang yang thag mi ring bar bal glang mo zhig phru gu byung ste /
translated: Not far from there a female elephant gave birth to a calf.

original: de bu byung ma thag tu seng ge'i sgra sgrogs nas de 'jigs sdangs nas phru gu bor te gcin rtug shor nas bros so //
analyzed: de bu byung ma thag tu seng ge'i sgra sgrogs nas de 'jigs sdangs nas phru gu bor te gcin rtug shor nas bros so //
translated: As soon as it was born, it roared like a lion. Frightened, the mother elephant dropped the calf and, defecating and urinating, ran away.

original: re zhig gcig na drang srong de bsti gnas nas byung nas bsti gnas de'i nye 'khor gyi phyogs su lta zhing song ba las /
analyzed: re zhig gcig na drang srong de bsti gnas nas byung nas bsti gnas de'i nye 'khor gyi phyogs su lta zhing song ba las /
translated: After some time, the sage went out of his hermitage and looked around the area.

original: ji tsam na glang po che'i phru gu gsar du byung ma thag pha ma dang bral ba de mthong ngo //
analyzed: ji tsam na glang po che'i phru gu gsar du byung ma thag pha ma dang bral ba de mthong ngo //
translated: He saw a young elephant who had recently lost his mother.

original: de nas drang srong de snying rjes bskyod pa'i snying gis de'i ma btsal ba'i phyir sgrim pa'i mig gis kun tu blta bar brtsams pa na /
analyzed: de nas drang srong de snying rjes bskyod pa'i snying gis de'i ma btsal ba'i phyir sgrim pa'i mig gis kun tu blta bar brtsams pa na /
translated: Then, with a heart moved by compassion, the sage looked around with focused eyes to find the elephant’s mother.

original: gang gi tshe gnas thams cad na ma snang ba de'i tshe /
analyzed: gang gi tshe gnas thams cad na ma snang ba de'i tshe /
translated: When he did not see the mother anywhere,

original: de khyer nas bsti gnas su zhugs te /
analyzed: de khyer nas bsti gnas su zhugs te /
translated: he carried the elephant back to his hermitage.

original: des de bu bzhin du bsnun bsnyod de bskyed do //
analyzed: des de bu bzhin du bsnun bsnyod de bskyed do //
translated: He raised the elephant like a son, nursing him with his milk.

original: de gang gi tshe chen por gyur pa de'i tshe drang srong de'i bsti gnas su gnod pa byed de /
analyzed: de gang gi tshe chen por gyur pa de'i tshe drang srong de'i bsti gnas su gnod pa byed de /
translated: When the elephant grew up, he caused harm in the sage’s hermitage.

original: me tog gi shing rnams 'byin par byed /
analyzed: me tog gi shing rnams 'byin par byed /
translated: He uprooted the flowering trees.

original: 'bras bu'i shing rnams kyi yal ga gcog par byed cing de dag dang gnod pa gzhan yang stong phrag dag byed do //
analyzed: 'bras bu'i shing rnams kyi yal ga gcog par byed cing de dag dang gnod pa gzhan yang stong phrag dag byed do //
translated: He broke the branches of fruit trees and did thousands of other kinds of harm.

original: drang srong des de la bsdigs te /
analyzed: drang srong des de la bsdigs te /
translated: The sage threatened him,🔽“If you do this again, I will kill you!”

original: drang srong des bsdigs pa na /
analyzed: drang srong des bsdigs pa na /
translated: When the sage threatened him,

original: de zhum zhum por byas te 'dug go /
analyzed: de zhum zhum por byas te 'dug go /
translated: he became timid and stayed put.

original: gang gi tshe 'dod chags skyes par gyur @253a *//🔽pa de'i tshe bsdigs kyang brnyas thabs byed do //
analyzed: gang gi tshe 'dod chags skyes par gyur @253a *// pa de'i tshe bsdigs kyang brnyas thabs byed do //
translated: But when lust arose in him,🔽he threatened the sage and insulted him.🔽Then one day the sage threatened him severely,🔽and he ran to kill the sage.

original: ji tsam dus gzhan zhig na drang srong des drag tu bsdigs pa dang / drang srong de nyid gsad par brgyugs pa dang / drang srong des spyil bo'i glo phug nas bros so //
analyzed: ji tsam dus gzhan zhig na drang srong des drag tu bsdigs pa dang / drang srong de nyid gsad par brgyugs pa dang / drang srong des spyil bo'i glo phug nas bros so //
translated: The sage fled through a hole in the side of the hut.

original: lhas tshigs su bcad pas smras pa /🔽sems can rab gdug byas pa chud gzon pa'i //
analyzed: lhas tshigs su bcad pas smras pa / sems can rab gdug byas pa chud gzon pa'i //
translated: The gods spoke this verse:🔽“It is not good to associate with evil people,

original: skyes bu ngan dang 'grogs pa bzang po min //🔽ji ltar ko'u shi ka yi bsti gnas su //
analyzed: skyes bu ngan dang 'grogs pa bzang po min // ji ltar ko'u shi ka yi bsti gnas su //
translated: who are very poisonous and waste their lives.🔽Just like the four sinful elephants

original: yun ring bskyed pa'i glang chen sdig byed bzhin //
analyzed: yun ring bskyed pa'i glang chen sdig byed bzhin //
translated: in the park of King Kṛkī.”

original: gus pas zas dang skom dang gnyi ga yis //
analyzed: gus pas zas dang skom dang gnyi ga yis //
translated: “What do you want with a bad person,

original: skye bo ngan bsten khyod la ci zhig dgos //🔽nges par ko'u shi ka yi bsti gnas su //
analyzed: skye bo ngan bsten khyod la ci zhig dgos // nges par ko'u shi ka yi bsti gnas su //
translated: who is not respectful with food, drink, or both?🔽He will certainly kill you in the end,

original: glang chen bzhin du de yis mthar grogs gsod //
analyzed: glang chen bzhin du de yis mthar grogs gsod //
translated: like the elephant killed the sage Kauśika.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: dge slong dag ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: dge slong dag ji snyam du sems /
translated: “Monks, what do you think?

original: de'i tshe de'i dus kyi drang srong gang yin pa de ni nga nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i dus kyi drang srong gang yin pa de ni nga nyid yin no //
translated: I am the one who was that sage then.

original: de'i tshe de'i dus kyi glang po che dam pa gang yin pa de ni lhas byin 'di nyid yin te /🔽de'i tshe de'i dus na yang 'di byas pa mi gzo zhing byas pa mi tshor ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i dus kyi glang po che dam pa gang yin pa de ni lhas byin 'di nyid yin te / de'i tshe de'i dus na yang 'di byas pa mi gzo zhing byas pa mi tshor ba yin no //
translated: The one who was the excellent elephant then is none other than Devadatta.🔽Even then he was ungrateful and did not appreciate what was done for him.

original: da ltar yang 'di byas pa mi gzo zhing byas pa mi tshor ba yin no //
analyzed: da ltar yang 'di byas pa mi gzo zhing byas pa mi tshor ba yin no //
translated: Now too he is ungrateful and does not appreciate what is done for him.

original: gzhan yang ji ltar 'di byas pa mi gzo zhing byas pa mi tshor ba de nyon cig /
analyzed: gzhan yang ji ltar 'di byas pa mi gzo zhing byas pa mi tshor ba de nyon cig /
translated: Listen to how he was ungrateful and did not appreciate what was done for him.🔽Once, when the Bodhisattva was living in the great forest, he was born as a lion.

original: dge slong dag sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus na grong khyer w'a ra n'a sir rgyal po dbang phyug chen po'i sde zhes bya ba 'byor pa dang rgyas pa dang bde ba dang lo legs pa dang skye bo dang / mi mang pos rab tu gang ba na rgyal srid byed du 'jug go //
analyzed: dge slong dag sngon byung ba 'das pa'i dus na grong khyer w'a ra n'a sir rgyal po dbang phyug chen po'i sde zhes bya ba 'byor pa dang rgyas pa dang bde ba dang lo legs pa dang skye bo dang / mi mang pos rab tu gang ba na rgyal srid byed du 'jug go //
translated: “Monks, in the past, in the city of Vārāṇasī, there ruled a king named Maheśvaraseṇa.

original: de'i btsun mo zla 'od ma zhes bya ba rmi lam rno ba yin te /
analyzed: de'i btsun mo zla 'od ma zhes bya ba rmi lam rno ba yin te /
translated: His queen, Candravatī, was skilled in interpreting dreams.

original: rmi lam du gang @253b ci mthong ba de thams cad de bzhin du 'gyur gyi gzhan du ma yin pa zhig yod do //
analyzed: rmi lam du gang @253b ci mthong ba de thams cad de bzhin du 'gyur gyi gzhan du ma yin pa zhig yod do //
translated: Whatever she saw in her dreams came to pass just as she had seen it, and not otherwise.

original: rgyal po de'i yul du byang chub sems dpa' ri dvags rnams kyi nang du skyes nas /
analyzed: rgyal po de'i yul du byang chub sems dpa' ri dvags rnams kyi nang du skyes nas /
translated: In that king’s realm, a bodhisattva was born among the deer.

original: gser gyi glo zhes bya ba ri dvags rnams kyi dpon por gyur to //
analyzed: gser gyi glo zhes bya ba ri dvags rnams kyi dpon por gyur to //
translated: He was known as Suvarṇakṣīra, and he became the leader of the deer.

original: de yang lus kyi gzi brjid bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang ldan zhing 'jig rten thams cad kyi yid dang mig tu sdug par byed pas 'dod pa skyed par byed do //
analyzed: de yang lus kyi gzi brjid bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang ldan zhing 'jig rten thams cad kyi yid dang mig tu sdug par byed pas 'dod pa skyed par byed do //
translated: Moreover, he had inconceivable physical splendor and was so attractive to the eyes and minds of all the world that he aroused desire.

original: gang gis de mthong na de rtog cing de nyid du sdod par byed do //
analyzed: gang gis de mthong na de rtog cing de nyid du sdod par byed do //
translated: Whoever saw him became infatuated and stayed right there.

original: de lhag par rtog pa na yid gnyis su gyur te /
analyzed: de lhag par rtog pa na yid gnyis su gyur te /
translated: When he thought about it, he became doubtful.

original: de rngon pas 'jigs pa dang 'jig rten pa gzhan gyis 'jigs pas 'tsher zhing skrag pas spyod do //
analyzed: de rngon pas 'jigs pa dang 'jig rten pa gzhan gyis 'jigs pas 'tsher zhing skrag pas spyod do //
translated: He was afraid of hunters and other people in the world, and he was afraid of being harmed.

original: 'di ni chos nyid yin te 'jig rten chags nas ring por ma lon pa na /
analyzed: 'di ni chos nyid yin te 'jig rten chags nas ring por ma lon pa na /
translated: It is natural that when a long time has passed since the world was formed,

original: dud 'gro rnams kyang mi'i skad du smra nus pa yin no //
analyzed: dud 'gro rnams kyang mi'i skad du smra nus pa yin no //
translated: even animals can speak the human language.

original: de nas bya rog gcig de'i drung du 'ongs nas /
analyzed: de nas bya rog gcig de'i drung du 'ongs nas /
translated: Then a crow came to him.

original: des de dang lhan cig bshes shing 'dris pa'i gtam byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: des de dang lhan cig bshes shing 'dris pa'i gtam byas nas smras pa /
translated: He spoke to the deer with the words of a friend:

original: kye zhang po khyod ci'i phyir 'di ltar 'tsher zhing skrag pas spyod /
analyzed: kye zhang po khyod ci'i phyir 'di ltar 'tsher zhing skrag pas spyod /
translated: “Hey, uncle, why are you acting like this, afraid and scared?”

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: The deer said,🔽“Nephew, I am afraid of being killed by hunters and other people in the world.”

original: tsha bo bdag gi lus skal ba dang ldan pa 'di la 'jig rten thams cad 'dod pa skyed pas kho bo 'jig rten gyis 'jigs shing rngon pas 'tsher zhing skrag pas spyod do //
analyzed: tsha bo bdag gi lus skal ba dang ldan pa 'di la 'jig rten thams cad 'dod pa skyed pas kho bo 'jig rten gyis 'jigs shing rngon pas 'tsher zhing skrag pas spyod do //
translated: The nephew said, Uncle, I am afraid of the world because everyone desires this body, which is my share of the family fortune. I am afraid of hunters and afraid of being harmed by them.

original: des smras pa zhang po bdag kyang de bas kyang 'ug pas 'jigs pas gcig la gcig bsrung bar bya ste /
analyzed: des smras pa zhang po bdag kyang de bas kyang 'ug pas 'jigs pas gcig la gcig bsrung bar bya ste /
translated: The uncle said, Nephew, I am also afraid of owls. We should protect each other.

original: bdag gis ni khyod nyin par bsrung ngo //
analyzed: bdag gis ni khyod nyin par bsrung ngo //
translated: I will protect you during the day.🔽You protect me at night.

original: khyod kyis ni bdag mtshan mo srungs shig ces de gnyis kyis de ltar dam bcas nas gnas so //🔽ji tsam na mi zhig dgras lag pa phying ka log tu bcings pas dam du bcings @254a *//
analyzed: khyod kyis ni bdag mtshan mo srungs shig ces de gnyis kyis de ltar dam bcas nas gnas so // ji tsam na mi zhig dgras lag pa phying ka log tu bcings pas dam du bcings @254a *//
translated: Having made this agreement, they lived there.

original: nas chu gzar du bab pa shugs drag po'i dba'i nang du bor te /
analyzed: nas chu gzar du bab pa shugs drag po'i dba'i nang du bor te /
translated: At one point a man was bound by his enemies with his hands tied behind his back and thrown into a swift-flowing river.

original: de des khyer ba na nyam thag pa'i nga ros snying rje rje'i skad du smre sngags 'don par byed de /🔽gang gis de ring bdag gi srog /
analyzed: de des khyer ba na nyam thag pa'i nga ros snying rje rje'i skad du smre sngags 'don par byed de / gang gis de ring bdag gi srog /
translated: As he was being carried away, he cried out in a pitiful voice, Alas!🔽Who will give me today

original: 'jig rten rnyed dka' sbyin 'gyur ba //
analyzed: 'jig rten rnyed dka' sbyin 'gyur ba //
translated: the life of a human so difficult to obtain in the world?

original: bdag gis de yi bran bya zhing //
analyzed: bdag gis de yi bran bya zhing //
translated: I will be his servant,

original: de yi go re long yang bya //
analyzed: de yi go re long yang bya //
translated: and his slave.

original: stes dbang gis ri dvags kyi dpon po de chu'i bsam pas ri dvags kyi tshogs kyis yongs su bskor te /
analyzed: stes dbang gis ri dvags kyi dpon po de chu'i bsam pas ri dvags kyi tshogs kyis yongs su bskor te /
translated: By chance, the deer king, thinking of water, was surrounded by a herd of deer.

original: 'bab chu'i 'gram du nye bar song ngo //
analyzed: 'bab chu'i 'gram du nye bar song ngo //
translated: He approached the bank of the river.

original: de nas mi'o dod 'bod pa thos nas ri dvags de rnams ni kun tu bros so //
analyzed: de nas mi'o dod 'bod pa thos nas ri dvags de rnams ni kun tu bros so //
translated: Then, hearing the human cry, the deer all ran away.

original: 'di ni chos nyid yin te /
analyzed: 'di ni chos nyid yin te /
translated: This is the nature of things:

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni lus kyis log par lhung ba yin yang /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni lus kyis log par lhung ba yin yang /
translated: Even though bodhisattvas are physically fallen,

original: sems kyis ma yin pas /
analyzed: sems kyis ma yin pas /
translated: they are not mentally.

original: ri dvags dpon po de snying rjes brlan pa'i snying gis mod la 'bab chu de'i nang du 'jug par brtsams pa na bya rog kyang de dang sngon dam bcas pa'i yid kyis kun tu bsrung ba'i phyir de'i phyi bzhin 'brang ba yin pas /
analyzed: ri dvags dpon po de snying rjes brlan pa'i snying gis mod la 'bab chu de'i nang du 'jug par brtsams pa na bya rog kyang de dang sngon dam bcas pa'i yid kyis kun tu bsrung ba'i phyir de'i phyi bzhin 'brang ba yin pas /
translated: So the deer king, with a heart moistened with compassion, immediately began to enter the river. The crow, with a mind that had previously made an agreement, followed him in order to protect him.

original: des mi de dbyung ba'i phyir 'bad pa byed par rig nas 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: des mi de dbyung ba'i phyir 'bad pa byed par rig nas 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Knowing that he was making an effort to rescue the man, he said this:

original: ri dvags kyi dpon po thong thong gzu lums ma byed /
analyzed: ri dvags kyi dpon po thong thong gzu lums ma byed /
translated: “Stop, stop, O king of deer! Do not act rashly!

original: mi 'di dag ni byas pa mi gzo zhing byas pa mi sems pa yin no //
analyzed: mi 'di dag ni byas pa mi gzo zhing byas pa mi sems pa yin no //
translated: These men are ungrateful and do not think of what others have done for them.”

original: byang chub sems dpa' bdag nyid chen po rnams ni mi bzlog pa yin pas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' bdag nyid chen po rnams ni mi bzlog pa yin pas /
translated: But the great bodhisattvas are not to be turned away.

original: des de'i tshig ma nyan par 'bab chu de'i nang du zhugs te /
analyzed: des de'i tshig ma nyan par 'bab chu de'i nang du zhugs te /
translated: So he did not listen to his words, and he entered the water.

original: bu gcig pa sdug pa bzhin du mi de rgyab tu skyon nas chu'i 'gram du byung ste /
analyzed: bu gcig pa sdug pa bzhin du mi de rgyab tu skyon nas chu'i 'gram du byung ste /
translated: Like a loving mother, he took the man on his back and came up to the bank.

original: bcings pa rnams bkrol zhing yud tsam zhig dbugs phyung nas @254b smras pa /
analyzed: bcings pa rnams bkrol zhing yud tsam zhig dbugs phyung nas @254b smras pa /
translated: He untied him and, after giving him a moment to catch his breath, said,

original: bu lam 'di nas ci dga' bar song zhig /
analyzed: bu lam 'di nas ci dga' bar song zhig /
translated: “Son, go on this path as you please.”

original: de nas mi des thal mo sbyar te ri dvags kyi dpon po'i rkang pa gnyis la gtugs nas 'di skad ces smras so //
analyzed: de nas mi des thal mo sbyar te ri dvags kyi dpon po'i rkang pa gnyis la gtugs nas 'di skad ces smras so //
translated: Then the man put his palms together and touched his head to the king of deer’s two feet and said this:

original: khyod kyis bdag gi srog gang lags //
analyzed: khyod kyis bdag gi srog gang lags //
translated: “What is my life worth?

original: 'jig rten rnyed dka' stsal bas na //
analyzed: 'jig rten rnyed dka' stsal bas na //
translated: You have given me the world, so hard to find.

original: yab cig khyod kyi 'bangs bdag ste //
analyzed: yab cig khyod kyi 'bangs bdag ste //
translated: Father, I am your subject.

original: de bzhin go re long yang bgyi //
analyzed: de bzhin go re long yang bgyi //
translated: I will be your servant and your slave.”

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He said,🔽“I am not your servant or your slave.

original: deng khyod bdag gi bran dang ni //
analyzed: deng khyod bdag gi bran dang ni //
translated: Today, you are my slave,

original: go re long yang ma byed par //
analyzed: go re long yang ma byed par //
translated: and you are not even my equal.

original: pags pa'i phyir ni bsad 'ong gis //
analyzed: pags pa'i phyir ni bsad 'ong gis //
translated: I will kill you for the sake of my skin.

original: khyod kyis bdag gzhan ma bstan cig /
analyzed: khyod kyis bdag gzhan ma bstan cig /
translated: Do not teach me about self and other.

original: bu khyod kyis mdor bya ba ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: bu khyod kyis mdor bya ba ni 'di yin te /
translated: Son, this is what you should do:

original: kho bo'i lus 'di 'jig rten thams cad kyis shin tu chags par bya ba dang / 'dod par bya ba yin pas khyod kyis kho bo su la yang ma bstan dang / byas pa la lan du phan btags pa yin no //
analyzed: kho bo'i lus 'di 'jig rten thams cad kyis shin tu chags par bya ba dang / 'dod par bya ba yin pas khyod kyis kho bo su la yang ma bstan dang / byas pa la lan du phan btags pa yin no //
translated: Since this body of mine is very desirable and lovable to the whole world, you should not show me to anyone.

original: de nas mi des de bzhin du bgyi'o zhes khas blangs nas ri dvags kyi dpon po la lan gsum bskor ba byas te rkang pa gnyis la gtugs nas song ngo //
analyzed: de nas mi des de bzhin du bgyi'o zhes khas blangs nas ri dvags kyi dpon po la lan gsum bskor ba byas te rkang pa gnyis la gtugs nas song ngo //
translated: Then the man agreed, saying, “I will do as you say,” and after circumambulating the king of deer three times, he touched his feet and left.

original: ji tsam dus gzhan zhig na btsun mo zla 'od ma rtsed mos dub nas mal chen por legs par gnyid log pa las mtshan mo'i thun tham la rmi lam du ri dvags kyi dpon po gzugs mchog tu sdug pa zhig seng ge'i khri la 'dug nas rgyal po'i
analyzed: ji tsam dus gzhan zhig na btsun mo zla 'od ma rtsed mos dub nas mal chen por legs par gnyid log pa las mtshan mo'i thun tham la rmi lam du ri dvags kyi dpon po gzugs mchog tu sdug pa zhig seng ge'i khri la 'dug nas rgyal po'i
translated: After some time Queen Candraprabha, exhausted from playing, fell into a deep sleep on her great bed. In the last part of the night she dreamed that the chief of the deer, whose form was extremely beautiful, sat on a lion throne and taught the Dharma to a great assembly of gods and humans.🔽

original: 'khor mang po la chos 'chad par mthong ngo //
analyzed: 'khor mang po la chos 'chad par mthong ngo //
translated: After some time, Queen Candraprabhā, exhausted from play, fell asleep on a large bed. In the last part of the night, she dreamed that the chief of the deer, his body of supreme beauty, was sitting on a lion throne, teaching the Dharma to a great assembly of kings.

analyzed: de nas rgyal pos rgyal po'i 'byor pa dang mthu chen pos btsun mo dang gzhon nu dang blon po dang grong mi dang yul mi dang bcas pas yongs su bskor cing 'dug go /
translated: Then the king, with great royal wealth and power, sat surrounded by his queens, princes, ministers, townspeople, and countrymen.

original: de nas @257b ri dvags kyi dpon po byang chub sems dpas 'khor la bltas nas rgyal po dang 'khor de la de lta bu'i chos bshad de /
analyzed: de nas @257b ri dvags kyi dpon po byang chub sems dpas 'khor la bltas nas rgyal po dang 'khor de la de lta bu'i chos bshad de /
translated: Then the deer king, the Bodhisattva, looked at his retinue and taught the Dharma to the king and his retinue like this.

original: de thos pas rgyal po 'khor dang bcas pas bslab pa lnga'i gzhi blangs so //
analyzed: de thos pas rgyal po 'khor dang bcas pas bslab pa lnga'i gzhi blangs so //
translated: Hearing it, the king and his retinue took up the five precepts.

original: sems can du ma dag gis ni dge ba'i rtsa ba dag thob bo //
analyzed: sems can du ma dag gis ni dge ba'i rtsa ba dag thob bo //
translated: Many sentient beings obtained roots of virtue.

original: de nas rgyal pos nags de ri dvags rnams la byin no //
analyzed: de nas rgyal pos nags de ri dvags rnams la byin no //
translated: Then the king gave the forest to the deer.

original: srog chags 'byung po thams cad la yang mi 'jigs pa byin no //
analyzed: srog chags 'byung po thams cad la yang mi 'jigs pa byin no //
translated: He gave protection to all living beings.

original: dge slong dag ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: dge slong dag ji snyam du sems /
translated: “Bhikṣus, what do you think?

original: de'i tshe de'i dus kyi ri dvags kyi dpon po gser gyi glo gang yin pa de ni nga nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i dus kyi ri dvags kyi dpon po gser gyi glo gang yin pa de ni nga nyid yin no //
translated: I am the one who was the golden-breasted deer king at that time, on that occasion.

original: de'i tshe de'i dus kyi mi gang yin pa de ni lhas byin 'di nyid yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i dus kyi mi gang yin pa de ni lhas byin 'di nyid yin te /
translated: The one who was the man at that time, on that occasion, was indeed this Devadatta.

original: de na yang 'di byas pa mi gzo ba dang byas pa mi tshor ba yin no //
analyzed: de na yang 'di byas pa mi gzo ba dang byas pa mi tshor ba yin no //
translated: Then, too, he was ungrateful and did not appreciate what was done for him.

original: da lta yang 'di byas pa mi gzo ba dang byas pa mi tshor ba yin no //
analyzed: da lta yang 'di byas pa mi gzo ba dang byas pa mi tshor ba yin no //
translated: Now, too, he is ungrateful and does not appreciate what is done for him.

original: gzhan yang ji ltar lhas byin 'di byas pa mi gzo zhing byas pa mi tshor ba 'di nyon cig /
analyzed: gzhan yang ji ltar lhas byin 'di byas pa mi gzo zhing byas pa mi tshor ba 'di nyon cig /
translated: Moreover, listen to how this Devadatta is ungrateful and does not appreciate what is done for him.

original: dge slong dag sngon byung ba ri por zhig na me tog phreng rgyud mkhan zhig gnas te /
analyzed: dge slong dag sngon byung ba ri por zhig na me tog phreng rgyud mkhan zhig gnas te /
translated: “Monks, once there lived a garland maker in a certain town.

original: de'i me tog gi ra ba chu'i pha rol na yod pas de nyi ma re re zhing chu rgal zhing me tog thu'o //
analyzed: de'i me tog gi ra ba chu'i pha rol na yod pas de nyi ma re re zhing chu rgal zhing me tog thu'o //
translated: His flower garden was on the other side of a river, so every day he would cross the river and gather flowers.

original: ji tsam dus gzhan zhig na /
analyzed: ji tsam dus gzhan zhig na /
translated: One day,

original: chu rgal ba na dus tshigs ma yin pa'i aa mra'i 'bras bu chus khyer ba zhig mthong nas des de blangs te /🔽sgo ba la byin no //
analyzed: chu rgal ba na dus tshigs ma yin pa'i aa mra'i 'bras bu chus khyer ba zhig mthong nas des de blangs te / sgo ba la byin no //
translated: while crossing the river, he saw a mango fruit that had fallen into the water. He picked it up🔽and gave it to the gatekeeper.

original: sgo bas gsol ka ba la'o //🔽gsol ka pas rgyal po la'o //
analyzed: sgo bas gsol ka ba la'o // gsol ka pas rgyal po la'o //
translated: The gatekeeper gave it to the cook.🔽The cook gave it to the king.

original: rgyal pos btsun mo la'o //
analyzed: rgyal pos btsun mo la'o //
translated: The king gave it to the queen.

original: btsun mos de myangs te myangs pa na rol zhen nas /
analyzed: btsun mos de myangs te myangs pa na rol zhen nas /
translated: The queen ate it and, after eating it, became attached to its taste.

original: rgyal po la gsol pa btab pa /
analyzed: rgyal po la gsol pa btab pa /
translated: She asked the king,🔽“Your Majesty, where did you get this?”

original: lha aa mra'i 'bras bu 'di 'dra ba gzhan yang stsal pa'i rigs so //
analyzed: lha aa mra'i 'bras bu 'di 'dra ba gzhan yang stsal pa'i rigs so //
translated: Your Majesty, please give me another such mango.

original: rgyal pos gsol ka pa la smras pa /🔽khyod kyis aa mra'i @258a *//
analyzed: rgyal pos gsol ka pa la smras pa / khyod kyis aa mra'i @258a *//
translated: The king said to the doorkeeper,

original: 'bras bu su las 'ongs /
analyzed: 'bras bu su las 'ongs /
translated: “Where did you get this mango?”

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He replied,

original: sgo srung gis stsal lags so //
analyzed: sgo srung gis stsal lags so //
translated: “The gatekeeper gave it to me.”

original: sgo srung la smras pa dang / des smras pa /
analyzed: sgo srung la smras pa dang / des smras pa /
translated: The king said to the gatekeeper,🔽“Where did you get this mango?”🔽He replied,

original: me tog phreng rgyud mkhan gyis stsal lags so //
analyzed: me tog phreng rgyud mkhan gyis stsal lags so //
translated: “The garland maker gave it to me.”

original: rgyal pos smras pa /
analyzed: rgyal pos smras pa /
translated: The king said,

original: shes ldan dag me tog phreng rgyud mkhan khug cig /
analyzed: shes ldan dag me tog phreng rgyud mkhan khug cig /
translated: “Sirs, summon the garland maker.”

original: rgyal po'i mi rnams kyis bkug nas rgyal pos smras pa /
analyzed: rgyal po'i mi rnams kyis bkug nas rgyal pos smras pa /
translated: When the king’s men summoned him, the king said,

original: kva'e me tog phreng rgyud mkhan khyod kyis aa mra'i 'bras bu 'di ga las rnyed /
analyzed: kva'e me tog phreng rgyud mkhan khyod kyis aa mra'i 'bras bu 'di ga las rnyed /
translated: “Hey, garland maker, where did you get this mango?”

original: des ji ltar gyur pa smras pa dang / rgyal pos de nyid la bsgo ba /
analyzed: des ji ltar gyur pa smras pa dang / rgyal pos de nyid la bsgo ba /
translated: When he told what had happened, the king said to him,

original: aa mra'i 'bras bu 'di 'dra ba gzhan yang khyer te shog cig /
analyzed: aa mra'i 'bras bu 'di 'dra ba gzhan yang khyer te shog cig /
translated: “Bring me another such mango.”

original: mi'i dbang po rnams kyi tshig ni gcig tu mi rung bas /
analyzed: mi'i dbang po rnams kyi tshig ni gcig tu mi rung bas /
translated: “The words of the lords of men cannot be wrong.

original: de bag tsha bas snying la zug cing aa mra'i 'bras bu btsal bar brtsams te /
analyzed: de bag tsha bas snying la zug cing aa mra'i 'bras bu btsal bar brtsams te /
translated: He was anxious and his heart was pained. He began to search for the mango fruit.

original: des rgyags khyer nas thog ma aa mra rnyed pa logs su song ba dang ri'i phyogs gcig na aa mra'i shing spre'u rnams kyi bgrod par gyur gyi mi rnams kyi ni ma yin pa de mthong nas /
analyzed: des rgyags khyer nas thog ma aa mra rnyed pa logs su song ba dang ri'i phyogs gcig na aa mra'i shing spre'u rnams kyi bgrod par gyur gyi mi rnams kyi ni ma yin pa de mthong nas /
translated: He carried the provisions and first found the mango. He went to one side of the mountain and saw a mango tree that was accessible to monkeys but not to humans.

original: de nas me tog phreng rgyud mkhan de shing de la phan tshun nas brtags nas g-yang sa chen por skyes pas mi rnams kyis bgrod pa ma yin te /
analyzed: de nas me tog phreng rgyud mkhan de shing de la phan tshun nas brtags nas g-yang sa chen por skyes pas mi rnams kyis bgrod pa ma yin te /
translated: Then the garland maker examined the tree from all sides. It had grown in a great abyss and was inaccessible to humans.

original: gzeg par mi nus so //
analyzed: gzeg par mi nus so //
translated: He could not climb it.

original: de de na aa mra'i 'bras bu 'dod pa'i phyir zhag mang du lon pas rgyags zad par gyur to //
analyzed: de de na aa mra'i 'bras bu 'dod pa'i phyir zhag mang du lon pas rgyags zad par gyur to //
translated: He stayed there for many days, wanting the mango fruit. His provisions were exhausted.

original: des bsams pa /
analyzed: des bsams pa /
translated: He thought,

original: bdag 'di bzhin du 'dug na rgyags med pas 'chir cha bas gcig gis ci byung ba byung gzeg go zhes rdo ba rnams la 'jus te gzeg par btsams pa las aa mra'i 'bras bu ma thob par g-yang du lhung ngo //
analyzed: bdag 'di bzhin du 'dug na rgyags med pas 'chir cha bas gcig gis ci byung ba byung gzeg go zhes rdo ba rnams la 'jus te gzeg par btsams pa las aa mra'i 'bras bu ma thob par g-yang du lhung ngo //
translated: If I stay like this, I will die without having eaten. One of you should do something! He grabbed hold of the rocks and tried to climb up, but he fell into the abyss without getting any mangoes.

original: ri de la byang chub sems dpa' spre'u ru gyur pa na /
analyzed: ri de la byang chub sems dpa' spre'u ru gyur pa na /
translated: When the Bodhisattva was a monkey,

original: spre'u rnams kyi @258b dpon por gyur to //
analyzed: spre'u rnams kyi @258b dpon por gyur to //
translated: he was the leader of a troop of monkeys.

original: stes dbang gis der ri de la tshogs bzhag ste /
analyzed: stes dbang gis der ri de la tshogs bzhag ste /
translated: By chance, he left the troop on that mountain

original: phyogs der phyin pa dang ji tsam na des me tog phreng rgyud mkhan de sdug bsngal dog cing nyam nga bar gyur pa mthong nas /
analyzed: phyogs der phyin pa dang ji tsam na des me tog phreng rgyud mkhan de sdug bsngal dog cing nyam nga bar gyur pa mthong nas /
translated: and went in that direction. When he got there, he saw that garland maker in a state of suffering and distress.

original: byang chub sems dpa' ni bzo'i gnas dang las kyi gnas de dang de dag la mkhas pa yin te /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' ni bzo'i gnas dang las kyi gnas de dang de dag la mkhas pa yin te /
translated: The Bodhisattva is skilled in this and that craft and occupation.

original: de de la phan pa bskyed pa lhur len pas rim gyis ma sad na dbyung bar mi nus so zhes rdo rnams kyis goms par bya bar brtsams te /
analyzed: de de la phan pa bskyed pa lhur len pas rim gyis ma sad na dbyung bar mi nus so zhes rdo rnams kyis goms par bya bar brtsams te /
translated: He thought, I will help him. If I don't wake him up gradually, I won't be able to get him out. He started to get the rocks used to it.

original: gang gi tshe de bdag gis dbyung bar nus so snyam du rig pa de'i tshe des de g-yang sa nas rim gyis phyung ba dang / rdo 'deg pa dang me tog phreng rgyud mkhan phyung bas shin tu dub par gyur to //
analyzed: gang gi tshe de bdag gis dbyung bar nus so snyam du rig pa de'i tshe des de g-yang sa nas rim gyis phyung ba dang / rdo 'deg pa dang me tog phreng rgyud mkhan phyung bas shin tu dub par gyur to //
translated: He was very tired from pulling out the stone-cutter and the garland-maker.

original: de'i tshe dud 'gro yang mi'i skad du smra ba yin pas des de la dris pa /
analyzed: de'i tshe dud 'gro yang mi'i skad du smra ba yin pas des de la dris pa /
translated: At that time, animals spoke the human language, so he asked him,

original: khyod ci'i phyir nyam nga ba 'di lta bu dang ldan par gyur /
analyzed: khyod ci'i phyir nyam nga ba 'di lta bu dang ldan par gyur /
translated: “Why are you in such a miserable state?”

original: des ji ltar gyur pa smras pa dang / byang chub sems dpas bsams pa /
analyzed: des ji ltar gyur pa smras pa dang / byang chub sems dpas bsams pa /
translated: He told him what had happened. The bodhisattva thought,

original: 'di aa mra'i 'bras bu med par song na gnod pa 'thob par 'gyur gyis /
analyzed: 'di aa mra'i 'bras bu med par song na gnod pa 'thob par 'gyur gyis /
translated: “If this man doesn’t get any mangoes, he will be harmed.🔽I will give him mangoes.”

original: bdag gis 'di la aa mra'i 'bras bu sbyin no snyam nas bdag nyid chen po de spro ba dang gzhan la phan par bya ba la brtson pa ma bor bas dub bzhin du yang shing de la 'dzegs nas aa mra'i 'bras bu glag par brtsams te /
analyzed: bdag gis 'di la aa mra'i 'bras bu sbyin no snyam nas bdag nyid chen po de spro ba dang gzhan la phan par bya ba la brtson pa ma bor bas dub bzhin du yang shing de la 'dzegs nas aa mra'i 'bras bu glag par brtsams te /
translated: The great being, not giving up his enthusiasm and his effort to help others, climbed the tree while still tired and began to pick mangoes.

original: mi de ji tsam 'dod kyi bar du aa mra'i 'bras bu zar bcug nas thu ba yang bkang ngo //
analyzed: mi de ji tsam 'dod kyi bar du aa mra'i 'bras bu zar bcug nas thu ba yang bkang ngo //
translated: He let the man eat as many mangoes as he wanted, and then filled his bag with them.

original: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sems can thams cad la bag 'bebs pa yin pas /🔽de nas spre'u yi dpon po de babs nas /
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni sems can thams cad la bag 'bebs pa yin pas / de nas spre'u yi dpon po de babs nas /
translated: But bodhisattvas are friendly to all sentient beings.

original: des mi de la smras pa kva'e nang rje kho bo dub pas yud tsam zhig nyal @259a *//
analyzed: des mi de la smras pa kva'e nang rje kho bo dub pas yud tsam zhig nyal @259a *//
translated: So the monkey chief came down and said to the man, “Hey, mister, I’m tired, so I’m going to sleep for a while.🔽Please wait here for a moment.”

original: gyis re zhig phyogs su byar gyis shig des smras pa /
analyzed: gyis re zhig phyogs su byar gyis shig des smras pa /
translated: “All right,” he said.

original: bka' bzhin 'tshal de gnyid log pa dang mi des bsams pa /
analyzed: bka' bzhin 'tshal de gnyid log pa dang mi des bsams pa /
translated: When the monkey fell asleep, the man thought,

original: bdag rgyags chad pas gal te aa mra rnams zos na ni bdag gis rgyal po la yang ci dbul /
analyzed: bdag rgyags chad pas gal te aa mra rnams zos na ni bdag gis rgyal po la yang ci dbul /
translated: “I’m out of provisions. If I eat the mangoes, what will I offer the king?

original: de bas na spre'u 'di bsad la sha skam du byas te lam du 'jug go snyam nas /
analyzed: de bas na spre'u 'di bsad la sha skam du byas te lam du 'jug go snyam nas /
translated: So I’ll kill this monkey and dry some of the meat to take along the road.”

original: snying rje med pa 'jig rten pha rol yal bar bor ba des de rdo ba chen pos bsad do //
analyzed: snying rje med pa 'jig rten pha rol yal bar bor ba des de rdo ba chen pos bsad do //
translated: The man, who was without compassion and indifferent to the next world, killed the monkey with a large rock.

original: lhas tshigs su bcad de smras pa /
analyzed: lhas tshigs su bcad de smras pa /
translated: A god spoke this verse:

original: phan 'dogs pa yi mtshan nyid dang // de bzhin drin gzo grogs por brjod //🔽mi rnams la yang kha cig ni //
analyzed: phan 'dogs pa yi mtshan nyid dang // de bzhin drin gzo grogs por brjod // mi rnams la yang kha cig ni //
translated: and likewise, of a friend who repays kindness.🔽Some people do not know

original: phan par byas pa mi shes so //
analyzed: phan par byas pa mi shes so //
translated: how to repay the help of others.

original: dge slong dag ji snyam du sems /
analyzed: dge slong dag ji snyam du sems /
translated: Monks, what do you think?

original: de'i tshe de'i dus kyi spre'u yi dpon po gang yin pa de ni nga nyid yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i dus kyi spre'u yi dpon po gang yin pa de ni nga nyid yin no //
translated: The one who was the leader of the monkeys at that time, on that occasion, was indeed me.

original: de'i tshe de'i dus kyi me tog phreng rgyud mkhan gang yin pa de ni lhas byin 'di nyid yin te /🔽de na yang 'di byas pa mi gzo ba dang / byas pa mi tshor ba yin no //
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i dus kyi me tog phreng rgyud mkhan gang yin pa de ni lhas byin 'di nyid yin te / de na yang 'di byas pa mi gzo ba dang / byas pa mi tshor ba yin no //
translated: The one who was the garland maker at that time, on that occasion, was indeed Devadatta.🔽Even then he did not repay my kindness and did not recognize what I had done for him.

original: da ltar yang 'di byas pa mi gzo zhing byas pa mi tshor ba yin no //
analyzed: da ltar yang 'di byas pa mi gzo zhing byas pa mi tshor ba yin no //
translated: Now as well he does not repay my kindness and does not recognize what I have done for him.

original: gzhan yang ji ltar 'di byas pa mi gzo ba dang byas pa mi tshor ba de nyon cig /
analyzed: gzhan yang ji ltar 'di byas pa mi gzo ba dang byas pa mi tshor ba de nyon cig /
translated: Listen to how he does not repay my kindness and does not recognize what I have done for him.🔽Once, when the Bodhisattva was living in the great forest as a king of the deer, he was surrounded by a herd of deer.

original: dge slong dag sngon byung ba byang chub sems dpa' ma nges pa'i phung po la gnas pa na grong rdal med pa'i dgon pa'i gnas ri bor dang ri phug chu dang me tog dang 'bras bus rgyas pa zhig tu bya rnams kyi nang du skyes te /
analyzed: dge slong dag sngon byung ba byang chub sems dpa' ma nges pa'i phung po la gnas pa na grong rdal med pa'i dgon pa'i gnas ri bor dang ri phug chu dang me tog dang 'bras bus rgyas pa zhig tu bya rnams kyi nang du skyes te /
translated: “Monks, in the past, when the Bodhisattva was still in the stage of being an ordinary person, he was born among birds in a place without towns, a remote place with mountains and caves, abundant with water, flowers, and fruit.

original: bya shing sta mo zhes bya bar gyur to //
analyzed: bya shing sta mo zhes bya bar gyur to //
translated: He was born as a woodpecker.

original: ri de nyid kyi phyogs zhig na ri dvags kyi rgyal po seng ge zhig ji ltar 'dod pa'i spyod pa @259b dang gnas pas ri dvags bsad cing bsad cing za bar byed do //
analyzed: ri de nyid kyi phyogs zhig na ri dvags kyi rgyal po seng ge zhig ji ltar 'dod pa'i spyod pa @259b dang gnas pas ri dvags bsad cing bsad cing za bar byed do //
translated: In a certain part of that mountain, a lion, king of beasts, lived as he pleased, killing and eating deer.

original: de dus gzhan zhig na sha zos pa las so'i bar du rus pa chud nas de 'jigs pa dang / bag tsha ba dang bral ba yin yang so'i nad kyi tshor bas lus la gnod par gyur nas blong bar gyur pas kha zas za ma nus so //
analyzed: de dus gzhan zhig na sha zos pa las so'i bar du rus pa chud nas de 'jigs pa dang / bag tsha ba dang bral ba yin yang so'i nad kyi tshor bas lus la gnod par gyur nas blong bar gyur pas kha zas za ma nus so //
translated: One time, while eating meat, a bone got stuck in his teeth. Although he was free from fear and anxiety, the pain of the toothache afflicted his body. He became depressed and was unable to eat.

original: stes dbang gis shing sta mo de shing kha gcig nas gcig tu rgyu ba la goms pas de phyogs de nas ri dvags kyi dpon po 'dug pa'i phyogs der 'ongs pa na des seng ge sdug bsngal gyi tshor bas nyen par mthong nas smras pa /
analyzed: stes dbang gis shing sta mo de shing kha gcig nas gcig tu rgyu ba la goms pas de phyogs de nas ri dvags kyi dpon po 'dug pa'i phyogs der 'ongs pa na des seng ge sdug bsngal gyi tshor bas nyen par mthong nas smras pa /
translated: The woodpecker, by chance, had become accustomed to moving from tree to tree. When he came to the place where the king of beasts was sitting, he saw the lion afflicted by the pain of an illness. He said,

original: zhang po ci'i phyir blong bar gyur /
analyzed: zhang po ci'i phyir blong bar gyur /
translated: “Uncle, why are you so depressed?”

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: The lion said,

original: tsha bo bdag sdug bsngal gyi tshor bas nyen to //
analyzed: tsha bo bdag sdug bsngal gyi tshor bas nyen to //
translated: “Nephew, I am afflicted by the pain of an illness.”

original: khyod kyi sdug bsngal ci lta bu zhig gis /
analyzed: khyod kyi sdug bsngal ci lta bu zhig gis /
translated: “What kind of pain do you have?”

original: des rgyas par smras pa dang / des smras pa /
analyzed: des rgyas par smras pa dang / des smras pa /
translated: The lion told him in detail. The woodpecker said,

original: zhang po khyod la bdag gis dpyad byas khyod ni seng ge yin te /
analyzed: zhang po khyod la bdag gis dpyad byas khyod ni seng ge yin te /
translated: “Uncle, I will treat you. You are a lion,

original: rkang bzhi pa thams cad kyi dpon po yin pas phan gdags par nus kyis khyod kyis bdag la dus dus su phan pa byos shig /
analyzed: rkang bzhi pa thams cad kyi dpon po yin pas phan gdags par nus kyis khyod kyis bdag la dus dus su phan pa byos shig /
translated: the king of all four-legged animals. You are able to help me. From time to time you must help me.”

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: The lion said,

original: de bzhin du bya'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du bya'o //
translated: “I will do that.”

original: shing sta mos bsams pa /
analyzed: shing sta mos bsams pa /
translated: The woodpecker thought,🔽“I will do this treatment for the lion.

original: ji ltar 'dis byed pa yang ma tshor ba de ltar 'di'i dpyad byas nas sos nas shes par 'gyur bar bya'o snyam mo //
analyzed: ji ltar 'dis byed pa yang ma tshor ba de ltar 'di'i dpyad byas nas sos nas shes par 'gyur bar bya'o snyam mo //
translated: “I will cure him by examining him in such a way that he does not even notice.”

original: de phan par bya ba lhur len pas de'i spyod pa dang gnas la rtog cing 'dug go /
analyzed: de phan par bya ba lhur len pas de'i spyod pa dang gnas la rtog cing 'dug go /
translated: With the intention of helping him, he observed the deer’s behavior and his habitat.

original: ji tsam na ri dvags kyi dpon po de rlung bde ba'i reg pas nad rtse zhil nas rdo ba cha zhing yangs pa zhig la kha gdangs nas gnyid log go /
analyzed: ji tsam na ri dvags kyi dpon po de rlung bde ba'i reg pas nad rtse zhil nas rdo ba cha zhing yangs pa zhig la kha gdangs nas gnyid log go /
translated: When the leader of the herd’s illness was cured by the pleasant touch of the breeze, he yawned and fell asleep on a flat, wide rock.

original: de nas shing sta mo de ri dvags kyi dpon po de'i drung du song nas /
analyzed: de nas shing sta mo de ri dvags kyi dpon po de'i drung du song nas /
translated: Then the woodcutter went to the leader of the herd.

original: de ltar bsod par gnas par mthong nas des @260a *//
analyzed: de ltar bsod par gnas par mthong nas des @260a *//
translated: Seeing that he was sleeping soundly,

original: bsam pa / 'di'i dpyad bya ba'i dus la bab po snyam du rig nas legs par brtags te so'i bar du chud pa'i rus pa 'dab mas bskyod pa'i rim pas mod la phyung ste skyes shing gnyid kyi snyoms pa gsal ba'i mig gis langs nas 'dug go /
analyzed: bsam pa / 'di'i dpyad bya ba'i dus la bab po snyam du rig nas legs par brtags te so'i bar du chud pa'i rus pa 'dab mas bskyod pa'i rim pas mod la phyung ste skyes shing gnyid kyi snyoms pa gsal ba'i mig gis langs nas 'dug go /
translated: he thought, “The time has come to examine him.” Knowing this, he carefully removed the bone that was stuck between his teeth by moving his lips with his fingers. He immediately woke up, his eyes wide open.

original: de nas shing sta mo des ri dvags kyi dpon po de sdug bsngal dang mid mi bde ba dang bral bar rig nas /
analyzed: de nas shing sta mo des ri dvags kyi dpon po de sdug bsngal dang mid mi bde ba dang bral bar rig nas /
translated: Then the woodpecker, knowing that the king of beasts was free from suffering and distress,

original: rab tu dga' ba'i yid kyis de'i drung du song ste smras pa /
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba'i yid kyis de'i drung du song ste smras pa /
translated: with a joyful mind went to him and said,

original: zhang po khyod kyi sdug bsngal gyi rgyur gyur pa ni rus pa 'di yin no //
analyzed: zhang po khyod kyi sdug bsngal gyi rgyur gyur pa ni rus pa 'di yin no //
translated: “Uncle, this bone is the cause of your suffering.”

original: de nas ri dvags kyi dpon po de mchog tu ngo mtshar skyes nas smras pa /
analyzed: de nas ri dvags kyi dpon po de mchog tu ngo mtshar skyes nas smras pa /
translated: Then the king of beasts, greatly astonished, said,

original: tsha bo la phan pa 'di'i lan khyod la bdag gis nges par slar phan par byas /
analyzed: tsha bo la phan pa 'di'i lan khyod la bdag gis nges par slar phan par byas /
translated: “Nephew, I must certainly repay you for this benefit you have given me.

original: dus dus su shog cig /
analyzed: dus dus su shog cig /
translated: Come from time to time.”

original: legs so de bzhin du bya'o zhes smras nas shing sta mo de song ngo //
analyzed: legs so de bzhin du bya'o zhes smras nas shing sta mo de song ngo //
translated: “Very well,” he said, and the woodpecker left.

original: ji tsam dus gzhan zhig na ri dvags kyi dpon po sha la za ba na shing sta mo de yang bya khra zhig gis zin te de'u shi ba las shor te bkres pas gdungs pa'i mig gis ri dvags kyi dpon po de'i drung du song ste /
analyzed: ji tsam dus gzhan zhig na ri dvags kyi dpon po sha la za ba na shing sta mo de yang bya khra zhig gis zin te de'u shi ba las shor te bkres pas gdungs pa'i mig gis ri dvags kyi dpon po de'i drung du song ste /
translated: Then later, when the king of beasts was eating meat, the woodpecker was seized by a hawk. He was about to die, but he escaped. With eyes burning with hunger, he went to the king of beasts.

original: nyam thag pa dag rig par byas nas smras pa /
analyzed: nyam thag pa dag rig par byas nas smras pa /
translated: The king saw that the man was weak and said,

original: zhang po bdag bkres pas gzir gyis sha la cung zad byin cig /
analyzed: zhang po bdag bkres pas gzir gyis sha la cung zad byin cig /
translated: “Uncle, I am starving. Please give me some of your flesh.”

original: des tshigs su bcad de smras pa /
analyzed: des tshigs su bcad de smras pa /
translated: The man spoke in verse:🔽“Now that you have come between my fangs,

original: da ltar kho bo srog gcod cing //
analyzed: da ltar kho bo srog gcod cing //
translated: I am a killer,

original: gtum po mi dge byed pa yi //🔽mche ba'i bar du khyod 'ongs pa //
analyzed: gtum po mi dge byed pa yi // mche ba'i bar du khyod 'ongs pa //
translated: a cruel one, and a nonvirtuous one.

original: gson pa'i drin chen mi sems sam //
analyzed: gson pa'i drin chen mi sems sam //
translated: Do you not think that I am very kind to let you live?”

original: des kyang tshigs su bcad de smras pa /
analyzed: des kyang tshigs su bcad de smras pa /
translated: The king spoke in verse:

original: rgya mtshor lhung ba phung ba ste //
analyzed: rgya mtshor lhung ba phung ba ste //
translated: “Falling into the ocean is a disaster.

original: rmi lam bsams pa don med do //
analyzed: rmi lam bsams pa don med do //
translated: Thinking about dreams is pointless.🔽Serving a bad man is pointless.

original: pho ngan @260b bsten pa gang yin dang // byas min gzo la byas don med //
analyzed: pho ngan @260b bsten pa gang yin dang // byas min gzo la byas don med //
translated: There is no point in repaying someone who has done nothing.”

original: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyis bka' stsal pa /
translated: The Blessed One said,

original: dge slong dag ji snyam du sems /🔽de'i tshe de'i dus kyi shing sta mo gang yin pa de ni nga nyid yin no //
analyzed: dge slong dag ji snyam du sems / de'i tshe de'i dus kyi shing sta mo gang yin pa de ni nga nyid yin no //
translated: “Monks, what do you think?🔽I am the one who was the woodman then.

original: de'i tshe de'i dus kyi ri dvags kyi rgyal po gang yin pa de ni lhas byin 'di nyid yin te /
analyzed: de'i tshe de'i dus kyi ri dvags kyi rgyal po gang yin pa de ni lhas byin 'di nyid yin te /
translated: The king of beasts then is now Devadatta.

original: de na yang 'di byas pa mi gzo ba dang byas pa mi tshor ba yin no //🔽da ltar na yang 'di byas pa mi gzo ba dang byas pa mi tshor ba yin no //
analyzed: de na yang 'di byas pa mi gzo ba dang byas pa mi tshor ba yin no // da ltar na yang 'di byas pa mi gzo ba dang byas pa mi tshor ba yin no //
translated: He was ungrateful and did not appreciate what was done for him.🔽Now too he is ungrateful and does not appreciate what is done for him.

original: gzhan yang ji ltar 'di byas pa mi gzo ba dang byas pa mi tshor ba de nyon cig /
analyzed: gzhan yang ji ltar 'di byas pa mi gzo ba dang byas pa mi tshor ba de nyon cig /
translated: Listen again to how he was ungrateful and did not appreciate what was done for him.

original: dge slong dag sngon byung ba grong khyer w'a ra n'a si na mi dbul po zhig gnas pa de shing btsongs te btsongs pas 'tsho bar byed do //
analyzed: dge slong dag sngon byung ba grong khyer w'a ra n'a si na mi dbul po zhig gnas pa de shing btsongs te btsongs pas 'tsho bar byed do //
translated: Monks, once there was a poor man in the city of Vārāṇasī. He made a living by selling wood.

original: de dus gzhan zhig na nang par sngar langs te /
analyzed: de dus gzhan zhig na nang par sngar langs te /
translated: One day, he got up early in the morning,

original: sta re dang khur shing dag thogs te shing gi phyir nags khrod du song ba dang dus ma yin pa'i char sprin chen po sna la rlung ldang ba langs so //
analyzed: sta re dang khur shing dag thogs te shing gi phyir nags khrod du song ba dang dus ma yin pa'i char sprin chen po sna la rlung ldang ba langs so //
translated: took an axe and a bundle of wood, and went into the forest to collect wood. A great untimely rain cloud rose up, with wind.

original: mi de 'di rung ngam mi rung ngam zhes gnas kyi khyad par tshol zhing shing nas shing gzhan gyi drung du song na 'on kyang gsher bar 'gyur ba nyid pas des shing drung brgyus te rim gyis brag phug gcig tu zhugs pa dang / des brag phug de na dom zhig gnas pa de mthong nas sngangs te 'bros par btsams pa las dom gyis smras pa /
analyzed: mi de 'di rung ngam mi rung ngam zhes gnas kyi khyad par tshol zhing shing nas shing gzhan gyi drung du song na 'on kyang gsher bar 'gyur ba nyid pas des shing drung brgyus te rim gyis brag phug gcig tu zhugs pa dang / des brag phug de na dom zhig gnas pa de mthong nas sngangs te 'bros par btsams pa las dom gyis smras pa /
translated: He saw a bear living in the cave and was frightened. He tried to run away, but the bear said,

original: bu ci'i phyir sdangs /
analyzed: bu ci'i phyir sdangs /
translated: Son, why are you afraid?

original: bu ma 'jigs par kho bo'i drung na 'dug cig /
analyzed: bu ma 'jigs par kho bo'i drung na 'dug cig /
translated: Son, don't be afraid. Stay with me.

original: de bag tsha bzhin du bred nas 'gro ma nus so //🔽de nas dom des dbugs phyung ste lag pa gnyis kyis pang du 'khyud nas rtsa ba dang 'bras bus @261a *//
analyzed: de bag tsha bzhin du bred nas 'gro ma nus so // de nas dom des dbugs phyung ste lag pa gnyis kyis pang du 'khyud nas rtsa ba dang 'bras bus @261a *//
translated: He was so terrified he couldn't move.🔽Then the bear comforted him and embraced him with both arms.

original: tshim par byas so //
analyzed: tshim par byas so //
translated: He satisfied him with roots and fruits.

original: yul ngan yang zhag bdun du byung /
analyzed: yul ngan yang zhag bdun du byung /
translated: For seven days there was bad weather.

original: lhas kyang char pa ma bcad do //
analyzed: lhas kyang char pa ma bcad do //
translated: The gods did not stop the rain.

original: zhag bdun 'das te /
analyzed: zhag bdun 'das te /
translated: After seven days,

original: zhag brgyad pa'i nyin par char sprin sangs nas /
analyzed: zhag brgyad pa'i nyin par char sprin sangs nas /
translated: on the eighth day the rain clouds cleared.

original: dom gyis phyogs bzhir bltas te rtsa ba dang / 'bras bu rab tu mang po byin nas mi de la smras pa /
analyzed: dom gyis phyogs bzhir bltas te rtsa ba dang / 'bras bu rab tu mang po byin nas mi de la smras pa /
translated: The bear looked in the four directions and gave him a lot of roots and fruit.

original: bu char sprin sangs te yul ngan med kyis ci bder song zhig /
analyzed: bu char sprin sangs te yul ngan med kyis ci bder song zhig /
translated: He said to the man, “Son, the rain clouds have cleared and there is no bad weather. Go wherever you like.”

original: mi des rkang pa la gtugs te smras pa /
analyzed: mi des rkang pa la gtugs te smras pa /
translated: The man touched his feet and said,

original: yab mchi na bdag gis khyod la lan ci zhig glan /
analyzed: yab mchi na bdag gis khyod la lan ci zhig glan /
translated: “Father, if I go, what can I give you in return?”

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He said,

original: bu ci nas kyang kho bo su la yang ma smras na de nyid kyis lan glan pa yin no //
analyzed: bu ci nas kyang kho bo su la yang ma smras na de nyid kyis lan glan pa yin no //
translated: “Son, if you don’t tell anyone about me, that will be your return.”

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He said,

original: yab de bzhin du bgyi'o zhes des de la bskor ba byas nas rkang pa la phyag byas te chas so //
analyzed: yab de bzhin du bgyi'o zhes des de la bskor ba byas nas rkang pa la phyag byas te chas so //
translated: “Father, I will do just as you say.” He circumambulated the bear, touched his feet, and left.

original: de w'a ra n'a sir zhugs pa dang / rngon pa zhig ri dvags 'chor du chas pa des de mthong nas smras pa /
analyzed: de w'a ra n'a sir zhugs pa dang / rngon pa zhig ri dvags 'chor du chas pa des de mthong nas smras pa /
translated: When he entered Vārāṇasī, a hunter who was going out to hunt saw him and said,

original: grogs po khyod dus 'di srid cig lon na gang nas 'dir 'ongs /
analyzed: grogs po khyod dus 'di srid cig lon na gang nas 'dir 'ongs /
translated: “Friend, it has been a long time since I saw you. Where have you come from?

original: khyod kyi bu smad ni khyod dus ma yin pa'i char zhag bdun bab pas sam /
analyzed: khyod kyi bu smad ni khyod dus ma yin pa'i char zhag bdun bab pas sam /
translated: Your wife and children must have been killed by the rain that fell for seven days at the wrong time.

original: gcan zan gyis bsad par ma gyur grang zhes skrag par gyur nas shin tu smre sngags 'don to //
analyzed: gcan zan gyis bsad par ma gyur grang zhes skrag par gyur nas shin tu smre sngags 'don to //
translated: “I’m afraid the beast will kill me.”

original: dus ma yin pa'i char zhag bdun bab pas bya dang ri dvags kyang du ma shi na khyod ji ltar shor /
analyzed: dus ma yin pa'i char zhag bdun bab pas bya dang ri dvags kyang du ma shi na khyod ji ltar shor /
translated: “When untimely rain fell for seven days and many birds and deer died, how did you survive?”

original: des ji ltar gyur pa rgyas par smras pa dang / des smras pa /
analyzed: des ji ltar gyur pa rgyas par smras pa dang / des smras pa /
translated: He told her in detail what had happened. She said,

original: grogs po dom de gang na 'dug pa'i phug de smros shig /
analyzed: grogs po dom de gang na 'dug pa'i phug de smros shig /
translated: “Friend, tell me the name of the cave where the bear lives.”

original: des smras pa /
analyzed: des smras pa /
translated: He said,

original: ne'u zla cis 'tsho yang bla /
analyzed: ne'u zla cis 'tsho yang bla /
translated: “Friend, I’ll do anything to survive,

original: slar nags khrod du ni mi 'gro'o //
analyzed: slar nags khrod du ni mi 'gro'o //
translated: but I won’t go back to the forest.”

original: des de la ji ltar khas len par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar sha'i skal ba sum nyis sbyin pas bslus pa dang / lam mtshon pa'i @261b phyir song ste /
analyzed: des de la ji ltar khas len par 'gyur ba de lta de ltar sha'i skal ba sum nyis sbyin pas bslus pa dang / lam mtshon pa'i @261b phyir song ste /
translated: She deceived him by giving him two-thirds of the meat and showing him the path.

original: ji tsam na rim gyis bdag nyid chen po'i dom de gang na gnas pa'i phug der phyin to //
analyzed: ji tsam na rim gyis bdag nyid chen po'i dom de gang na gnas pa'i phug der phyin to //
translated: After a while, he reached the cave where the great being lived.

original: de nas snying rje med pa la gnas pa byas pa mi gzo bas smras pa /
analyzed: de nas snying rje med pa la gnas pa byas pa mi gzo bas smras pa /
translated: Then the ungrateful one, who was devoid of compassion, said,

original: phug 'di na dom gnas so //
analyzed: phug 'di na dom gnas so //
translated: “The bear lives in this cave.”

original: de nas rngon pa pha rol gyi srog la gnod pa byed pas phug der me btang ngo //
analyzed: de nas rngon pa pha rol gyi srog la gnod pa byed pas phug der me btang ngo //
translated: Then the hunter set fire to the cave, intending to kill the bear.

original: de nas bdag nyid chen po'i dom de du bas subs pa'i yid dang mig mchi mas gang bas tshigs su bcad de smras pa /
analyzed: de nas bdag nyid chen po'i dom de du bas subs pa'i yid dang mig mchi mas gang bas tshigs su bcad de smras pa /
translated: Then the great bear, his mind and eyes filled with smoke, spoke in verse:

original: bdag ni ri'i sul gnas bcas te //
analyzed: bdag ni ri'i sul gnas bcas te //
translated: “I lived in the mountains,

original: rtsa ba 'bras bu chu 'thung zhing //
analyzed: rtsa ba 'bras bu chu 'thung zhing //
translated: drinking water and eating roots and fruit.

original: sems can la ni phan blo yis //
analyzed: sems can la ni phan blo yis //
translated: With the intention to help sentient beings,

original: su la gnod pa ci zhig byas //
analyzed: su la gnod pa ci zhig byas //
translated: what harm did I do to anyone?

original: 'chi ba'i dus la bab gyur pas //
analyzed: 'chi ba'i dus la bab gyur pas //
translated: Now that the time of death has come,

original: da ni ci yang byar med de //🔽lus can 'dod dang mi 'dod pa'i //
analyzed: da ni ci yang byar med de // lus can 'dod dang mi 'dod pa'i //
translated: there is nothing I can do.🔽I will follow the actions of embodied beings,

original: las kyi rjes su 'brang bar bya //
analyzed: las kyi rjes su 'brang bar bya //
translated: whether desired or not.”

original: zhes smras nas shi'o //
analyzed: zhes smras nas shi'o //
translated: Having said this, he died.

original: de nas de rnams kyis bshas te sha bgos nas /
analyzed: de nas de rnams kyis bshas te sha bgos nas /
translated: Then they skinned the bear and divided the meat.

original: byas pa chud gzon pa'i mi de la smras pa /
analyzed: byas pa chud gzon pa'i mi de la smras pa /
translated: They said to the man who had wasted his efforts:

original: sha'i skal ba sum nyis long zhig /
analyzed: sha'i skal ba sum nyis long zhig /
translated: “Take two-thirds of the meat as your share.”

original: des blang ngo zhes lag pa gnyis brkyang pa dang sa la lhung ngo //
analyzed: des blang ngo zhes lag pa gnyis brkyang pa dang sa la lhung ngo //
translated: He said, “I’ll take it,” and stretched out his two arms, but fell to the ground.

original: de nas rngon pa de rnams kyis de ltar ma rung ba de mthong nas kyi hud kyi hud ces smras te /
analyzed: de nas rngon pa de rnams kyis de ltar ma rung ba de mthong nas kyi hud kyi hud ces smras te /
translated: Then the hunters, seeing that it had come to such a pass, cried out, “Alas! Alas!”

original: rang rang gi skal ba yang bor nas dong ngo //
analyzed: rang rang gi skal ba yang bor nas dong ngo //
translated: They threw away their shares and went off.

original: shin tu ya mtshan du gyur pa de skye bo'i tshogs chen pos thos nas phyogs der 'dus so //
analyzed: shin tu ya mtshan du gyur pa de skye bo'i tshogs chen pos thos nas phyogs der 'dus so //
translated: A great crowd of people heard about that very strange thing and gathered there.

original: rgyal po tshangs sbyin yang ya mtshan skyes nas de nyid du 'ongs so //
analyzed: rgyal po tshangs sbyin yang ya mtshan skyes nas de nyid du 'ongs so //
translated: King Brahmadatta, hearing about it, was amazed and came there himself.🔽In one place on the mountain there was a monastery of the saṅgha. There King Brahmadatta took the skin and, opening the eye of wonder, thought, “I will inform the saṅgha of monks of this matter.”

original: ri de'i phyogs gcig cig na dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang yod pas de nas rgyal po tshangs sbyin gyis de'i pags pa blangs te ya mtshan gyi mig phye nas don de dge slong gi dge 'dun la rig par bya'o zhes dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang der
analyzed: ri de'i phyogs gcig cig na dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang yod pas de nas rgyal po tshangs sbyin gyis de'i pags pa blangs te ya mtshan gyi mig phye nas don de dge slong gi dge 'dun la rig par bya'o zhes dge 'dun gyi gtsug lag khang der
translated: He went to that monastery of the saṅgha and,

original: song nas pags pa dag @262a *//
analyzed: song nas pags pa dag @262a *//
translated: spreading out the skin,

original: bting ste / rgan pa'i mtha' logs su 'dug nas /
analyzed: bting ste / rgan pa'i mtha' logs su 'dug nas /
translated: sat down at the end of the row of elders.

original: dge 'dun la don de rgyas par smras so //
analyzed: dge 'dun la don de rgyas par smras so //
translated: He told the saṅgha of monks the matter in detail.

original: de na gnas brtan dgra bcom pa zhig yod pa des tshigs su bcad de rgyal po de la smras pa /
analyzed: de na gnas brtan dgra bcom pa zhig yod pa des tshigs su bcad de rgyal po de la smras pa /
translated: An elder arhat who was there spoke this verse to the king:

original: rgyal chen 'di ni dom ma lags //
analyzed: rgyal chen 'di ni dom ma lags //
translated: “Great king, this is not a bear.

original: byang chub sems dpa' gzi 'chang ste //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' gzi 'chang ste //
translated: He is a bodhisattva who possesses splendor.🔽Great king, you should worship him,

original: rgyal chen 'jig rten gsum po dang // khyod kyis kyang ni mchod 'os lags //
analyzed: rgyal chen 'jig rten gsum po dang // khyod kyis kyang ni mchod 'os lags //
translated: for he is worthy of worship by the three worlds.”
